programme.title: They Made Me a Fugitive (1947)
programme.desc: Soho black marketeers frame a former RAF pilot for murder, forcing him to go on the run until he can exact revenge on them. Thriller, starring Trevor Howard, Sally Gray and Griffith Jones

programme.title: Danger Within (1959)
programme.desc: British officers detained in an Italian PoW camp intend to escape, but an informer threatens to scupper their audacious plan. The group is forced to make haste with its scheme when one of the officers is sentenced to death as German soldiers prepare to take over the facility. Second World War drama, starring Richard Todd, Bernard Lee, Michael Wilding, Richard Attenborough and Donald Houston

programme.title: The Man Who Haunted Himself (1970)
programme.desc: A respectable executive recovers after a car accident, only to find that he has been seen in places he has never been to, has ruined his own business and is having an affair. He becomes convinced a double of him now exists, and is destroying his life, but also fears he may be losing his mind. Psychological thriller, starring Roger Moore, Hildegarde Neil, Anton Rodgers and Freddie Jones

Sci-fi action horror, starring Milla Jovovich, Michelle Rodriguez and James Purefoy

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dealer recruits con artists Matron Jackie, Gideon and Henry the Hearse Chaser to attend an auction where he is selling a painting, to purposely bid against each other to bump up the price. However, Lady Jane also bids and after discovering the ruse concocts a plan to get her own back and wipe the smile off Lovejoy's face. Charlotte Cornwell guest stars with Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Malick blames himself when Paul's brother dies, but the ordeal is not yet over, and the volatile medic is left anxiously waiting to see whether his ex-lover can recover from kidney failure. Meanwhile, an encounter with a happily married couple prompts Chrissie to contemplate her relationship with Dan again, and Jac takes out her frustration on newcomer Kip Maxwell after losing baby Freya. Guest starring Maureen Lipman

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Valerie arranges for the hospital to hold a service for Ewart. A school minibus collides with a car turning what had previously been a quiet night in Casualty into a frantic one

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gary Best has no choice but to arrest Gina Gold after a breathalyser test proves positive, leaving his belligerent boss facing serious trouble. Honey Harman also finds herself in a tricky situation - thanks to no-good boyfriend Fletch. Polly Page is shocked when Owen Preston's nephew turns up, wanting to know what happened to his uncle

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat's furious about Garry's neglect of Lynne as Garry attends to Bobby and Laura. Can Laura reveal the truth?

programme.title: Classic EastEnders

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part two of two. Lovejoy sets out to exact revenge on the dealer responsible for deceiving his American acquaintance - and make a little money for himself into the bargain. Linda Gray and Brian Blessed guest star, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Joanna discovers a patient's seemingly trivial snoring problem hides a deep-seated problem requiring sensitive handling. Andrew grabs every opportunity to continue his affair with Kate, and the unexpected reappearance of a childhood sweetheart forces Sam to confront his feelings for Kerri. Gary Mavers, Haydn Gwynne and John McCardle star

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Diana tries her hand at being nice for a 'glamorous granny' competition at Bayview. Stephanie Cole stars

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch tries to ensure that Godber has not blown his chances of early release after he gets into a fight a week before his parole board hearing. Final episode of the classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Local PCs Cooper and Walsh try to master a new crime-fighting technique. However, the duo's carefully laid plans unravel when Barry decides to treat a retired vicar to a day trip. Long-running sitcom, starring Ken Kitson and Louis Emerick

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The women of the village are impressed by a series of fanciful tales told by a retired jewel thief about his larcenous exploits in the south of France. However, the scoundrel's skills are put to the test when Marina and Miss Davenport seek his aid in helping Auntie Wainwright crack a keyless safe. John Challis guest stars

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The duo are called out to a private zoo, where human remains have been found in the tigers' den. The evidence points to an unfortunate accident, but Dalziel suspects foul play - and a connection to a mysterious disappearance he investigated 20 years previously. Detective drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A car in which a teacher was murdered five years earlier is returned to its owner - the victim's husband. Pullman reopens the unsolved case, hoping to track down the dead woman's secret lover, who is known to have had a small tattoo - a clue that eventually leads to a male prostitute. Detective drama, starring Amanda Redman, James Bolam, Dennis Waterman and Alun Armstrong

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The body of a member of the Jewish Hasidic community is discovered, and the team agrees to perform a 'dry' post mortem to respect the wishes of his faith. A forensic link is found to a group of Polish labourers, but Harry begins to wonder whether the victim's wife is hiding something, and decides to carry out a full autopsy to determine the time of death

programme.desc: A virtuoso violinist baffles Lovejoy by asking him to help pull off an elaborate con involving a fake Stradivarius - so he enlists an expert to find out what is going on. Whimsical drama, starring Ian McShane

programme.desc: Andy puts pressure on Phil to grass up Dennis. Kate forces Joanne to admit their similar taste in men

programme.title: Classic EastEnders

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice receives a surprise visit from her father's mistress and is shocked to learn the truth about her financial difficulties, while Evie begins her first day as an apprentice dressmaker. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard

programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer returns from six months in Spain to find a guest of Lady Jane has fled Peru with a priceless Inca ring. Joanna Lumley guest stars, with Ian McShane

programme.desc: Sam's medical bag is stolen, leading to a crisis for one of his patients. An accident at a local knitwear factory presents Andrew with a case of divided loyalties, while Joanna and Tom face tough decisions about their future. Rural medical drama, starring Gary Mavers and Joseph Millson, with guest appearances by Keith Barron and Carol Drinkwater

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Harvey tries to cut staff costs by employing illegal immigrants, and soon has the residents up in arms. Tom decides he wants to be as fit as Linford Christie, but faces opposition from a concerned Diana. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole, Graham Crowden and Daniel Hill

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: First episode of the classic comedy sequel. Bob travels down to London in his efforts to find a suitable wedding present, where fate sees him reunited with Terry, returning home after a gruelling spell in the Army. Starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam. From 1973

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: When Alvin and Entwistle witness Lance attempting to prove to his wife that Elvis Presley is still alive, the duo feel duty-bound to help him out, and organise for the King himself to make an appearance. Long-running comedy starring Brian Murphy, Burt Kwouk and Kenneth Cope

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: When Eva, a worldly wise former acquaintance of Alvin arrives in the village, while Marina discovers she might have some competition as the apple of Howard's eye. Long running comedy, guest starring Shirley Ann Field

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: When Peter refuses to post bail for Simon, Lyle manages to secure his release using a case of money left behind when he was arrested. A well-to-do woman seeks the services of Kingdom and Kingdom to force an American pilot to support her unborn baby - but investigations reveal neither party is being completely honest

programme.title: Maisie Raine
programme.desc: The stalking of a TV game show host seems an ideal case for trainee detective Kyprianou to cut his teeth on, but Maisie soon regrets her decision to hand him the investigation. Police drama, starring Pauline Quirke and Steve John Shepherd

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team is asked to reinvestigate the 1975 death of a union leader, whose body was found in the Thames. As the detectives delve deeper into the case, a financial scandal involving misappropriated funds is uncovered and a Labour peer points the finger of suspicion at the victim's deputy, but Brian's increasingly erratic behaviour threatens to hamper the inquiry. Frances Barber, Kenneth Cranham and Dave Hill guest star

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: A boy's body is discovered near his school, and a search is launched when the classmate he was last seen with is reported missing. After it transpires the deceased was abused and has traces of an unknown toxic chemical in his body, the youngsters' headmaster, a man who used to teach Nikki, becomes a suspect - and a second corpse is found. Reece Dinsdale guest stars

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents live coverage of the opening play on the 10th day from the All England Club, featuring doubles matches in the third Grand Slam of the year

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the 10th day from the All England Club, as the Grand Slam continues with quarter-finals in the men's and ladies' singles. Simona Halep produced a dominant display at this stage last year to defeat Amanda Anisimova 6-2, 6-4. That match was followed on Centre Court by a five-set epic between Rafael Nadal and Taylor Fritz, which saw Nadal eventually take the honours. However, the victory came at a cost, with the two-time champion unable to continue in the competition due to injury

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the magazine show with stories of interest from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil thinks Lisa is hiding something from him about Louise and Sharon worries about Keanu's attitude to money. Eve makes the wrong move when meddling in Stacey's love life and Rocky decides to throw a surprise hen party for Kathy

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Tim Gunn brings all his skill to bear restoring a wartime bicycle once owned and used by a Bletchley Park code-breaker. Soft toy restorers Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell take on a bear-on-wheels, much loved by his owner Janet, who was diagnosed with cerebral palsy as a child. Plus, Steve Fletcher recruits fellow expert and sister Suzie to work on a neglected and battered old Victorian firefighter's helmet

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk discover treasures in everyday homes. In the first episode, they head to Shropshire to help a couple with an emotional downsize following the tragic death of their teenage son 10 years earlier. They discover a collection of pieces by the famed carpenter Robert 'Mouseman' Thompson, as well as breathing life back into some neglected furniture

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The five remaining sewers compete in the quarter-finals and are challenged to make garments inspired by history's most influential fashion Icons. For the Pattern Challenge, judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young draw on old-time Hollywood glamour with a dress reminiscent of Audrey Hepburn's little black dress in Breakfast at Tiffany's. The Transformation challenge is inspired by Esme's work with fashion label Swanky Modes, specifically their range of garments made from shower curtains, and finally, in the Made to Measure, the sewers are asked to make smoking jackets

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Emily Atack already knows she has showbusiness in her blood - her mother is singer and impressionist Kate Robbins, and Paul McCartney is her grandmother's cousin. Now she wants to learn more about her entertainment roots. Along the way she visits Liverpool to hear more about the McCartneys, and is also told tales of theatrical whistlers, Welsh footballers and Yorkshire miners. Anecdotes regarding struggles with mental health still resonate 130 years later. Narrated by Phil Davis

programme.title: Wireless Festival
programme.desc: Showcasing highlights and performances from the weekend at Wireless Festival in London's Finsbury Park with performances from some of the biggest stars in Rap, Hip-Hop and RnB including Playboi Carti, Travis Scott, 50 Cent, D-Block Europe, Lil Yachty and Ice Spice

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A tree surgeon nears tragedy after plummeting from an oak tree. Plus, a cave adventure risks calamity when flash flooding causes an influx of water into the caving network. Presented by Nick Knowles

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Rabbits are fiercely territorial and here keeper Gemma is attempting to introduce a pair of new rabbits into the group that are already at the park. She first creates a wall down the middle of the enclosure so all the rabbits can sense each other, but even this is not without risk. It's Whisper they need to watch - she is the dominant bunny they expect to be the least welcoming to the new pair. Serena, one of the largest and oldest rabbits in the group, could get overwhelmed by the situation and there is a real risk of her experiencing a heart attack. Presented by Kate Humble and Ben Fogle

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin, Martel Maxwell and Jacqui Joseph follow the online sales and renovations of a 'forever home' in Whitehaven, Cumbria, a quirky corner house in Coleshill, Warwickshire, and a three-bedroom terraced house in Goldborne, Greater Manchester

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from the Gloucester Antiques Centre, where the red and blue teams go shopping for treasures with experts Kate Bliss and Charles Hanson. Away from the contest, Charlie learns about astronomer William Herschel, who discovered the planet Uranus

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents live coverage of the 11th day from the All England Club, featuring the ladies' singles semi-finals. Ons Jabeur reached the first of her two Grand Slam finals in 2022 at this stage last year when she claimed a 6-2, 3-6, 6-1 victory over Tatjana Maria. Elena Rybakina was confirmed as her opponent in the showpiece match when she produced an impressive display to prevail 6-3, 6-3 against 2019 champion Simona Halep

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Rocky goes rogue on his stag night and Kathy is hurt by a cutting comment from Elaine on her hen do. The consequences of Keanu's actions begin and tempers rage as Phil and Kat argue with Lisa over what she is really up to

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: On a trip to the Peak District, Mark Wright, his brother Josh and father Mark Sr begin take to the water on the River Derwent. Josh and Mark's kayak down the rapids becomes a no-holds-barred race, leaving one triumphant and the other fuming. Mark Sr meanwhile takes a more relaxed journey downstream, taking in the scenery from the comfort of a rubber ring. Next stop is the town of Bakewell, where they sample its famous sweet delicacies. That night they set up camp and as the sun sets, Josh reveals how he's feeling about his footballing career drawing to a close and his fears for the future

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In Fleet, Hampshire, Stuart and his daughter Freya call upon Flo Headlam and Lee Burkhill's help to create a relaxing family garden, incorporating separate, more private spaces. Freya is looking for somewhere to hang out with friends and relax without conflicting with her dad. The garden is small and has to accommodate some storage and a place for Stuart to work and collect his thoughts. They both want to encourage more insects and wildlife into the garden and need the designers' help to make the most of their £4,000 budget. Lee and Flo both offer up schemes for consideration, but who has really nailed the brief?

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Born to an Irish mother and a Jamaican father, radio presenter Dev Griffin grew up feeling he didn't fit in with either community so hopes discovering more about his ancestors will help strengthen his sense of identity and belonging. In Ireland, Dev uncovers the momentous events surrounding the lives of his Irish grandmother's dad, his great grandfather. Following his father's line, Dev travels to Jamaica, where an emotional meeting with a newly discovered aunt leads him to an incredible document from the local Baptist church that reveals the daily lives of his great grandparents. Narrated by Phil Davis

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Brooklyn (2015)
programme.desc: An Irish woman living with her mother in the 1950s decides to make a fresh start in America. She makes her home in New York, and falls in love. However, her past catches up with her when she receives bad news from Ireland, and faces a harsh choice between her two homes. Drama based on Colm Toibin's novel, starring Saoirse Ronan, Domhnall Gleeson, Jim Broadbent and Julie Walters

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley presents the contest from Hemswell in Lincolnshire. Experts Izzie Balmer and Mark Stacey help guide the Red and Blue teams to a prime purchase in a bid to make the greater profit at auction. Caroline also hits the road to learn about the small bubble cars that were once very popular on British roads

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The newsreader travels around the country, immersing himself in Italian culture and sampling its renowned cuisine, beginning in the south-eastern region of Puglia. Clive discovers how the James Bond franchise helped turn an abandoned town into a world heritage site, finds out why Puglia is the gay holiday capital of Italy and learns to play in a traditional pizzica band

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the Britain of his youth, starting at Preston's Fulwood Barracks and heading to Bury Bolton Street Station in Greater Manchester

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the latest Super League matches, including Hull Kingston Rovers v Hull FC, Warrington Wolves v St Helens and Salford Red Devils v Leeds Rhinos

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents live coverage of the ninth day from the All England Club, including the opening men's and ladies' quarter finals, as well as doubles contests. Cameron Norrie became the first British player to reach the semi-finals of this tournament since Andy Murray was crowned champion in 2016 when he eventually prevailed 3-6, 7-5, 2-6, 6-3, 7-5 against Belgium's David Goffin at this stage last year to set up a clash with Novak Djokovic. Over on Centre Court, Ons Jabeur of Tunisia also had to fight back to defeat Czech player Marie Bouzkova 3-6, 6-1, 6-1, and she will be hoping to still be in contention this time around after eventually finishing as runner-up to Elena Rybakina in 2022

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents further live coverage of the ninth day from the All England Club, as the singles quarter-finals continue and last-eight contests also take place in the men's and ladies' doubles

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Qasa Alom presents highlights of the ninth day's play at the All England Club, as the men's and ladies' quarter-finals got under way. Novak Djokovic, Cameron Norrie, Ons Jabeur and Tatjana Maria all booked their semi-final places on day nine 12 months ago

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Couple Irene and Richard remodel their three-bedroom Croydon home, which has started to feel too small after living there for 19 years, with three teenagers fighting for space. Richard's biggest bugbear is being made to wait for hours to use the only bathroom in the house, while Irene is desperate for more space but is unwilling to get rid of her industrial sized tumble dryer, and architects Lizzie Fraher and Laura Jane Clark will have to incorporate a place for her prized possession into their design

programme.title: 3 Non-Blondes
programme.desc: Hidden-camera comedy show featuring the talents of Tameka Empson, Jocelyn Jee Esien and Ninia Benjamin, who take to the streets of Britain in guises ranging from tarts touting for Jesus to African performance poets. First broadcast in 2003

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: County Lines (2019)
programme.desc: A 14-year-old boy, bullied at school, is approached by a young man who appears to offer him protection. However, this is in fact the start of the youngster being groomed as a smuggler for the man's nationwide drug-selling enterprise. Drama, starring Harris Dickinson, Montserrat Roig de Puig and Marcus Rutherford

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: How one cyclist uses social media to recover stolen bikes. Plus, how police are using body heat sensors to prevent robberies from trades people's vans

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: An anonymous tip leads police to crack the UK's biggest case of food fraud. An officer's instinct uncovers a conspiracy to commit massive insurance fraud and a faulty break light leads to police arresting two high level drug dealers

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: After renting for many years in London, actress Jill Halfpenny and her 13-year-old son Harvey made the big decision to start a new life in the North East, where Jill was brought up. They both love the sea views of their new home in Tynemouth, but the flat's layout is revealing its glitches. The kitchen is right at the back of the property, making it feel dark and disconnected, the bathroom has no windows and the only outside space is a tiny balcony. Using virtual reality techniques, architects Will Foster and Lynsey Elliot compete to remodel the property

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph and Tommy Walsh track the developments of two homes and a piece of land in Suffolk, Nottinghamshire and Kent, all bought from online auctions

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A tranquil paddle boarding trip in Gibraltar takes a deadly turn. Plus, a woman risks her life saving her beloved dog from a burning building. Presented by Nick Knowles

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: All eyes are on the nests at RSPB Arne in Dorset. Will they fledge before the night is over? Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan look back over the series to see who the main cast of characters have been. Megan McCubbin continues to explore the peripheries of the reserve, and looks at some of its more intriguing inhabitants

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Coverage of the 10th day from the All England Club, including quarter-finals in the men's and ladies' singles and doubles. Eventual champion Elena Rybakina came back from a set down against Ajla Tomljanovic at this stage last year, prevailing 4-6, 6-2, 6-3. Nick Kyrgios then made serene progress with a 6-4, 6-3, 7-6 victory over Cristian Garin. In the mixed doubles, British player Neal Skupski and his American partner Desirae Krawczyk defeated Mate Pavic and Sania Mirza in the semi-finals, ensuring at least one competitor from the host nation would participate in a final

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the 10th day from the All England Club, including the scheduled conclusion of the singles and doubles quarter-finals

programme.title: Murder on the Blackpool Express
programme.desc: Feature-length comedy about a crime writer (Griff Rhys Jones) who takes a group of his fans on a coach tour of locations from his books. The bus is soon leaving a string of bodies in its wake, and the passengers are faced with the possibility of a murderer in their midst. With Johnny Vegas, Nigel Havers and Una Stubbs

programme.title: Nowhere Special (2020)
programme.desc: When John, a 35-year-old window cleaner, is given only a few months to live, he attempts to find a new, perfect family for his three-year-old son, determined to shield him from the terrible reality of the situation. Drama, starring James Norton, Daniel Lamont and Eileen O'Higgins

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Angela, Gloria and Julia tackle the appliance cover policies that aren't worth a penny and the trade finder website that doesn't do the checks it should. Plus, smart meter advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: An unusual licence plate helps police crack an international smuggling operation and a call about a disturbance leads officers to discover a huge haul of firearms. A group of youths smoking cannabis leads to the solving of a string of robberies

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Cage fighting pro Stevie 'Braveheart' Ray is just one fight away from becoming Scotland's first world champion. This documentary captures the all-or-nothing tale of the lead-up to a major prize fight - and the aftermath - as told through the eyes of his wife Natalie, a 30-year-old mother of four. The PFL world championship is staged in Madison Square Gardens, New York, and the top prize is a million dollars. However, MMA can be dangerous, with fighters having only a pair of 4oz gloves for protection. Both physical pain and mental health are factors to be considered

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents from Newark, and visits the Welbeck Estate to learn about a series of underground building projects from the 1800s. With Raj Bisram and Roo Irvine

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A solo climber risks his life when things go wrong on remote snowy peak, and a dog walk in idyllic rural countryside threatens one woman's life when she's trampled by cows

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Godfather fan Clive is in Sicily, where he visits the village that Francis Ford Coppola used to film a wedding in his classic movie The Godfather. He also joins geologists working on Mount Etna to predict its next eruption and heads to Modica to learn how to make a chocolate bar from an ancient recipe

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's railway journey reaches Greater Manchester, where he celebrates new beginnings for the nation in the years after the Second World War. At Trafford General Hospital, he investigates the birth of the National Health Service. A retired physiotherapist recalls her part in the historic event of July 5, 1948. Coronation Star tells Michael about the first episode of the soap, broadcast live in 1960. And at the city's Science and Industry Museum, the presenter encounters a replica of the Baby, which was created in 1948 - the first machine in the world to run a stored program and the forerunner of all modern computers

programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents live coverage of the 11th day from the All England Club, where the men's doubles semi-finals were among the matches scheduled to be played today. Croatia's Nikola Mektic and Mate Pavic defeated Juan Sebastian Cabal and Robert Farah of Colombia in five sets at this stage last year

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents further live overage of the 11th day from the All England Club, where the men's doubles semi-finals were set to continue and the mixed doubles final was also set to take place. There was a British winner in the mixed doubles last year when Neal Skupski and his American partner Desirae Krawczyk claimed an impressive 6-4, 6-3 triumph over Australian duo Matthew Ebden and Samantha Stosur. Fatigue perhaps played a part in Ebden's defeat, as he and compatriot Max Purcell earlier booked their place in the men's doubles final with a gruelling five-set victory over American Rajeev Ram and home player Joe Salisbury

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Qasa Alom presents highlights of the 11th day's play at the All England Club, featuring the ladies' singles semi-finals and the mixed doubles final. Ons Jabeur and Elena Rybakina triumphed to become the singles finalists last year, and Neal Skupski and Desirae Krawczyk claimed the mixed doubles title

programme.title: Alas Smith & Jones
programme.desc: Mel Smith and Griff Rhys Jones provide the laughs in an episode of their second series from 1985, a show that has everything - comedy, music and a nasty skin complaint

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: As NASA releases the inaugural images from the James Webb Space Telescope, this film tells the inside story of the instrument's construction, and the astronomers taking its first picture of distant stars and galaxies. Will it be the deepest image of our universe ever taken?

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: Xand Van Tulleken considers the deadly effects of diet pills and whether breakfast truly is the most important meal. Plus, the myth that local honey helps hayfever is busted

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: The final episode explores the challenges that ocean life must overcome, including baby elephant seals and humpback whales endangered as their mothers end up surrounded by males vying for supremacy. A lone sealion chases tuna, one of the fastest fish in the ocean. Not only must it find a way of catching this enormous fish, but it must do so whilst fighting off hungry sharks

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: DIY legend Tommy Walsh, expert cleaner Maxine Dwyer and carpenter Asher Edwards head to north London to help grandmother Maura make over her messy lounge. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, they build a birdwatching area for her grandchildren, fix the unsafe stairs and give the living room a new identity by creating a multi-purpose family space

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Mark Wright, his brother Josh and father Mark Sr head to Skegness, Lincolnshire. After enjoying the resort's pier and funfair, the trio hit the beach. Over a meal of fish and chips, they reminisce about the family holidays of Josh and Mark's childhood. Next, the trio take to the water on jet skis. Family joker Mark can't resist soaking his dad, but an angry Mark Sr gets his revenge. As the sun sets, an emotional Mark opens up to his comnpanions, admitting an obsession with work isolated him from his family, changed him as a person and almost pushed him to the edge

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Steam Days
programme.desc: Miles Kington looks at freight trains - the workhorses of Britain's railways - and the pattern of their usage before motorways. He examines the role of the British Rail Standard Class 9F steam locomotive, one of the most powerful to run on British railways, and hitches a lift in the cab of 92203 Black Prince. First shown in 1986

programme.title: Gyles Brandreth Remembers...Hinge & Bracket
programme.desc: Gyles Brandreth remembers the work of the comedy and musical duo

programme.title: Dear Ladies
programme.desc: Comedy from 1984 set in the genteel village of Stackton Tressel, starring Dr Evadne Hinge and Dame Hilda Bracket (George Logan and Patrick Fyffe). The ladies feel themselves drawn into a mid-life crisis and go in search of new hobbies and activities

programme.title: Hancock's Half Hour
programme.desc: Sid finds himself in court, accused of a smash-and-grab raid - and is none too pleased to learn his defence counsel is Hancock QC

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Mrs Chambers takes it on herself to ensure her daughter's wedding is fit for a queen, but her over-the-top ideas soon meet with disapproval. Stirred up by Terry's ridicule, the men rebel

programme.title: Babs
programme.desc: Biopic of Barbara Windsor, following the key events of the actress's life over the course of 50 years. The story begins in 1993, with the actress preparing for a stage performance shortly before joining the cast of EastEnders. She looks back to her childhood as a lonely evacuee in the Second World War, her rise to fame in the Carry On films and her difficult relationships with her father and her first husband, gangster Ronnie Knight. Samantha Spiro, Jaime Winstone, Honor Kneafsey and Windsor herself share the lead role

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: A look back at the iconic hairdos people in Britain have flirted with over the past 60 years. From the meringue-like confections of Raymond 'Teasy Weasy', via the geometric bob cuts of Vidal Sassoon, to the big-hair heyday of bouffants and beehives - not forgetting the mullet and the 1970s perms. Part of the Timeshift documentary strand

programme.title: Origins of Us
programme.desc: Anatomist and anthropologist Alice Roberts reveals the story of human evolution as told through the body, revealing that the way people think, look and behave is a product of the six-million-year journey that took man from forest-dwelling apes to the most successful species on the planet. She begins with the skeleton, revealing how the evolutionary journey of man's ancestors has affected everything from the way a person walks and runs to the back pain they suffer, their narrow waist and the shape of their bottom

programme.title: Steam Days
programme.desc: Miles Kington looks at freight trains - the workhorses of Britain's railways - and the pattern of their usage before motorways. He examines the role of the British Rail Standard Class 9F steam locomotive, one of the most powerful to run on British railways, and hitches a lift in the cab of 92203 Black Prince. First shown in 1986

programme.title: Dear Ladies
programme.desc: Comedy from 1984 set in the genteel village of Stackton Tressel, starring Dr Evadne Hinge and Dame Hilda Bracket (George Logan and Patrick Fyffe). The ladies feel themselves drawn into a mid-life crisis and go in search of new hobbies and activities

programme.title: Babs
programme.desc: Biopic of Barbara Windsor, following the key events of the actress's life over the course of 50 years. The story begins in 1993, with the actress preparing for a stage performance shortly before joining the cast of EastEnders. She looks back to her childhood as a lonely evacuee in the Second World War, her rise to fame in the Carry On films and her difficult relationships with her father and her first husband, gangster Ronnie Knight. Samantha Spiro, Jaime Winstone, Honor Kneafsey and Windsor herself share the lead role

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Treasures
programme.desc: Dan Cruickshank tries to find the Ark of the Covenant, travelling across Ethiopia in search of the lost relic

programme.title: Fred Dibnah: Steeplejack
programme.desc: A chance to see the 1979 documentary that introduced Bolton steeplejack and engineering enthusiast Fred Dibnah to the world. He talks about how he got started in his line of work, reveals why he loves it so much and is seen knocking down chimneys and other building in the industrial wasteland of northern England

programme.title: New Zealand: Earth's Mythical Islands
programme.desc: Sam Neill narrates the story of some of New Zealand's wildest places, home to hyper-intelligent parrots, snails with teeth, and constellations of glow-worms. In these often inhospitable locations, any creature hoping to survive must resort to radical techniques, none more so than on the South Island, which lies toward Antarctica and is home to the rapidly rising peaks of the Southern Alps

programme.title: Immortal Egypt with Joann Fletcher
programme.desc: Archaeologist and historian Joann Fletcher explores the story of Ancient Egypt and begins with a search of the building blocks that made he civilisation so enduring. She discovers how its people changed from primitive farmers to pyramid builders in just a few centuries, and finds early evidence for Egypt's gods and its obsession with death and the afterlife. She also reveals how the first writing was used to calculate taxes and examines Egypt's first pyramid - one of the world's earliest stone structures

programme.title: Alan Bennett Remembers...An Englishman Abroad
programme.desc: Alan Bennett looks back on his 1983 television drama based on the true story of a chance meeting in Moscow between actress Coral Browne and British defector Guy Burgess

programme.title: An Englishman Abroad
programme.desc: A woman is shocked to find a mysterious Englishman standing in her dressing room, and assumes he must be from the embassy - but there is more to the shady character than meets the eye. Alan Bennett's drama, starring Alan Bates, Coral Browne and Charles Gray

programme.title: Alan Bennett: Dinner at Noon
programme.desc: Alan Bennett documentary first broadcast in 1988, in which the writer observes life in the public areas of a Harrogate hotel and adds his own wry commentary to the events captured on film, including a depiction of puberty through the medium of Scottish dance and a proposal to stage a fashion show using charity shop stock

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: A celebration of the British seaside holiday experience, from its Victorian origins and heyday in the 1950s, through its slow decline and attempts at modern-day reinvention

programme.title: Fred Dibnah: Steeplejack
programme.desc: A chance to see the 1979 documentary that introduced Bolton steeplejack and engineering enthusiast Fred Dibnah to the world. He talks about how he got started in his line of work, reveals why he loves it so much and is seen knocking down chimneys and other building in the industrial wasteland of northern England

She also reveals how the first writing was used to calculate taxes and examines Egypt's first pyramid - one of the world's earliest stone structures

programme.title: New Zealand: Earth's Mythical Islands
programme.desc: Sam Neill narrates the story of some of New Zealand's wildest places, home to hyper-intelligent parrots, snails with teeth, and constellations of glow-worms. In these often inhospitable locations, any creature hoping to survive must resort to radical techniques, none more so than on the South Island, which lies toward Antarctica and is home to the rapidly rising peaks of the Southern Alps

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: The team investigates the controversial world of alien communication, asking whether humans would communicate with them, or should communicate with them at all. Exoplaneteer George Dransfield travels to the Jodrell Bank Observatory to meet astrophysicist Professor Tim O'Brien, who explains how scientists around the world use radioastronomy to listen for extraterrestrial signals

programme.title: Shipwrecks: Britain's Sunken History
programme.desc: Maritime historian Dr Sam Willis reveals the stories behind some of the shipwrecks that surround Britain's coastline. He begins by examining how the top-heavy Mary Rose became a source of national embarrassment and discovers why the wrecking of the Spanish Armada was so unexpected. He also considers the terrifying real-life disasters that inspired two great castaway tales - The Tempest by William Shakespeare and Daniel Defoe's Robinson Crusoe

programme.title: Thelma & Louise (1991)

Mrs Griggs is horrified - she could do without the chaos he inevitably brings with him - but he won't take no for an answer. When she's not picked as goalie for the team Jas is actually relieved - it must mean she's still jinxed and hasn't passed on the jinx to her dad. Eventually Jas does need to play in goal, but when she saves a crucial penalty she and her dad are delighted to realise they are not jinxed after all, just accident-prone! Find out how we can help to look after them and our planet, and why and how they grow and survive in different climates. Maddie explores plants in the rainforest, big and small, and sees how the clever drip-tip leaves work watering the plants beneath them. We’ll see how plants in hot, dry parts of world like the desert thrive in their own special ways, like the cactus plant that stores litres of water in its waxy leaves. And we’ll learn how plants that grow close to home in the UK, can grow in a colder and wetter climate.

programme.title: Fred & Pete's Treasure Tales
programme.desc: The boys find a wooden plank buried in the sand on a beach. What could it be? As usual, their guesses and drawings are way off the mark, so they decide to take the plank off to Suzy and Archie at the Museum of Cornish Treasures. From there, they discover the history of Cornish surfing, how boards are made and how surf rescuers keep people safe in the water

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The Octonauts follow a strange song to a lonely humpback whale, who is alone because he doesn't sound like the other whales

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey, Bingo and their cousins make Dad and Uncle Stripe play a game of Horsey Ride.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: The kids are late for a playdate, but they can't leave before they finish their game

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: There are odd noises in the supermarket. Supertato discovers that Evil Pea and the Mini Peas are asleep and walking through the supermarket. Supertato tries to get them back to bed

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: The team helps Grandmaster Glitch take selfies around Europe

programme.title: GiggleQuiz
programme.desc: Captain Adorable recruits Gail's toy mascot to be his new sidekick

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Evie's teacher comes for a home visit and the Brooklyn-Bells want Waffle to be on his best behaviour, but Waffle cannot stop chewing everything

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: The little girl and her feathery friend have a sleepover with some friends, but struggle to get to nod off

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo and Gran Gran go strawberry picking and make jam to preserve the berries for longer.

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: The Hoot Planet is visiting the Clangers. But something odd has happened to the lovely music it usually plays! And then wool starts raining down from the sky

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: Tombliboo Eee keeps going the wrong way while trying to get out of the house

programme.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories
programme.desc: Greg James reads A Couch for Llama

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of the ninth day from the All England Club, featuring the opening men's and ladies's quarter finals. There was nearly an upset on Centre Court at this stage last year, when reigning champion Novak Djokovic lost the opening two sets of his match against Italy's Jannik Sinner, but the Serbian eventually discovered his best form and bounced back to prevail 5-7, 2-6, 6-3, 6-2, 6-2. Meanwhile, Tatjana Maria defeated German compatriot Jule Niemeier 4-6, 6-2, 7-5 on the No. 1 Court

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon and Keanu prepare to introduce Albie to Peggy and Stacey goes on a date with Theo despite Martin's disapproval. Kim's return to work doesn't go as well as she had hoped and Bobby executes his plan to infiltrate Rocky's stag night

programme.title: Brave Britain with Fergal Keane
programme.desc: Award-winning reporter Fergal Keane goes in search of hope in today's Britain, turning to those in hard-pressed communities and hearing stories of everyday courage. From Glasgow shipyard workers to Leeds council estate residents to tenant farmers in Cornwall, Fergal shines light on the unheard voices of courage across the country

programme.title: Joe Swash: Teens in Care
programme.desc: Joe Swash reveals the harsh reality of what it's like growing up in the care system, spending time with teenagers who are all at crucial stages of their life. Joe's mum Kiffy has been a foster carer for over 15 years and he wants to spend time with teens across the UK who live in foster care, in residential children's homes, and some who have left at 18 and are trying to make it alone, to show what growing up as a teenager in care is really like

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Ruck Stars
programme.desc: Documentary following the rising stars of the Under 18 academies of two of the biggest teams in world rugby, the Scarlets and the Ospreys, as they chase the dream of going pro. Fullback Cori returns after a foot injury that could have derailed his career. Talented centre Dafydd looks to make his mark. Macs is feeling the pressure of being one of the players already on contract

programme.title: Body on the Beach: What Happened to Annie?
programme.desc: Journalist Hazel Martin investigates the death of Annie Borjesson, a Swedish woman who was found dead on Prestwick Beach. Within hours of her body being found her family were told it was suicide, but they believe the evidence points to murder

programme.title: Body on the Beach: What Happened to Annie?
programme.desc: Hazel Martin pieces together the mysterious final hours before Annie Borjesson was found dead and hears an extraordinary theory that her death was a state sponsored hit-job

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Just as Sam and Jay are set to host a friend's wedding that could get their bed-and-breakfast business off the ground, the ghost of Hetty's husband tries to ruin it

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Sasappis offers to help Sam complete the B&B website so they can start taking reservations, while Pete bonds with Jay over basketball, until Jay makes a new living friend

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the 10th day from the All England Club, as the Grand Slam continues with quarter-finals in the men's and ladies' singles. Simona Halep produced a dominant display at this stage last year to defeat Amanda Anisimova 6-2, 6-4. That match was followed on Centre Court by a five-set epic between Rafael Nadal and Taylor Fritz, which saw Nadal eventually take the honours. However, the victory came at a cost, with the two-time champion unable to continue in the competition due to injury

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the magazine show with stories of interest from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil thinks Lisa is hiding something from him about Louise and Sharon worries about Keanu's attitude to money. Eve makes the wrong move when meddling in Stacey's love life and Rocky decides to throw a surprise hen party for Kathy

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Tim Gunn brings all his skill to bear restoring a wartime bicycle once owned and used by a Bletchley Park code-breaker. Soft toy restorers Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell take on a bear-on-wheels, much loved by his owner Janet, who was diagnosed with cerebral palsy as a child. Plus, Steve Fletcher recruits fellow expert and sister Suzie to work on a neglected and battered old Victorian firefighter's helmet

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: Bringing the glitz, glamour and big lashes into Judges Bingo hall are drag artistes Dominic and Tom, in full drag personae as Lady Frieda Wild and the Dominique Trix. They've got a surprise in store for the locals and with their feather boas and cinched waists they are the talk of Tonypandy. Also enjoying a family night out are Nash, his sister Yazmin and son Azaad. However, it's not all about bingo jackpots as between games Yazmin and Azaad have a pep talk lined up for Nash. Two other players sporting big lashes are workmates Mel and Louise, who are enjoying some time out from the day job

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The five remaining sewers compete in the quarter-finals and are challenged to make garments inspired by history's most influential fashion Icons. For the Pattern Challenge, judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young draw on old-time Hollywood glamour with a dress reminiscent of Audrey Hepburn's little black dress in Breakfast at Tiffany's. The Transformation challenge is inspired by Esme's work with fashion label Swanky Modes, specifically their range of garments made from shower curtains, and finally, in the Made to Measure, the sewers are asked to make smoking jackets

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Kiri's TV Flashback
programme.desc: Comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean rewinds the most amusing snippets from half a century of Welsh television, this time crashing some parties and finding out how the Welsh celebrate the things that really matter in life. From weddings to Saint David's Day, Wales is a nation that likes to go that extra mile when it comes to marking special occasions

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Emily Atack already knows she has showbusiness in her blood - her mother is singer and impressionist Kate Robbins, and Paul McCartney is her grandmother's cousin. Now she wants to learn more about her entertainment roots. Along the way she visits Liverpool to hear more about the McCartneys, and is also told tales of theatrical whistlers, Welsh footballers and Yorkshire miners. Anecdotes regarding struggles with mental health still resonate 130 years later. Narrated by Phil Davis

programme.title: Wireless Festival
programme.desc: Showcasing highlights and performances from the weekend at Wireless Festival in London's Finsbury Park with performances from some of the biggest stars in Rap, Hip-Hop and RnB including Playboi Carti, Travis Scott, 50 Cent, D-Block Europe, Lil Yachty and Ice Spice

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A tree surgeon nears tragedy after plummeting from an oak tree. Plus, a cave adventure risks calamity when flash flooding causes an influx of water into the caving network. Presented by Nick Knowles

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Rabbits are fiercely territorial and here keeper Gemma is attempting to introduce a pair of new rabbits into the group that are already at the park. She first creates a wall down the middle of the enclosure so all the rabbits can sense each other, but even this is not without risk. It's Whisper they need to watch - she is the dominant bunny they expect to be the least welcoming to the new pair. Serena, one of the largest and oldest rabbits in the group, could get overwhelmed by the situation and there is a real risk of her experiencing a heart attack. Presented by Kate Humble and Ben Fogle

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin, Martel Maxwell and Jacqui Joseph follow the online sales and renovations of a 'forever home' in Whitehaven, Cumbria, a quirky corner house in Coleshill, Warwickshire, and a three-bedroom terraced house in Goldborne, Greater Manchester

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from the Gloucester Antiques Centre, where the red and blue teams go shopping for treasures with experts Kate Bliss and Charles Hanson. Away from the contest, Charlie learns about astronomer William Herschel, who discovered the planet Uranus

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents live coverage of the 11th day from the All England Club, featuring the ladies' singles semi-finals. Ons Jabeur reached the first of her two Grand Slam finals in 2022 at this stage last year when she claimed a 6-2, 3-6, 6-1 victory over Tatjana Maria. Elena Rybakina was confirmed as her opponent in the showpiece match when she produced an impressive display to prevail 6-3, 6-3 against 2019 champion Simona Halep

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Rocky goes rogue on his stag night and Kathy is hurt by a cutting comment from Elaine on her hen do. The consequences of Keanu's actions begin and tempers rage as Phil and Kat argue with Lisa over what she is really up to

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: On a trip to the Peak District, Mark Wright, his brother Josh and father Mark Sr begin take to the water on the River Derwent. Josh and Mark's kayak down the rapids becomes a no-holds-barred race, leaving one triumphant and the other fuming. Mark Sr meanwhile takes a more relaxed journey downstream, taking in the scenery from the comfort of a rubber ring. Next stop is the town of Bakewell, where they sample its famous sweet delicacies. That night they set up camp and as the sun sets, Josh reveals how he's feeling about his footballing career drawing to a close and his fears for the future

programme.title: Iolo's Anglesey
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores the wildlife of Anglesey. Wales' largest island is renowned for its coastal beauty, but it also has fantastic marshland and heathland with spectacular wildlife. In this episode, Iolo observes breeding marsh harriers - majestic birds of prey that have only recently started to nest in Wales. He also finds stoats, grey seals and lizards. Iolo also visits Puffin Island to find the only breeding site in Wales for eider ducks. On a disused railway line, he finds breeding adders

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Born to an Irish mother and a Jamaican father, radio presenter Dev Griffin grew up feeling he didn't fit in with either community so hopes discovering more about his ancestors will help strengthen his sense of identity and belonging. In Ireland, Dev uncovers the momentous events surrounding the lives of his Irish grandmother's dad, his great grandfather. Following his father's line, Dev travels to Jamaica, where an emotional meeting with a newly discovered aunt leads him to an incredible document from the local Baptist church that reveals the daily lives of his great grandparents. Narrated by Phil Davis

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
programme.desc: Born on a farm in the Brecon Beacons, Delyth Prothero grew up passionate about athletics. After a serious injury ended her competing career as a discus thrower, Delyth turned her attention to coaching. By the 1990s, as Wales team manager, she was responsible for some of the biggest names in British athletics, including Colin Jackson, Iwan Thomas, Jamie Baulch and Matt Elias. This documentary celebrates Delyth's understated success with warmth and humour, as some of the superstars of Welsh athletics come together to pay tribute to the woman they all called 'Mam'

programme.title: Brooklyn (2015)
programme.desc: An Irish woman living with her mother in the 1950s decides to make a fresh start in America. She makes her home in New York, and falls in love. However, her past catches up with her when she receives bad news from Ireland, and faces a harsh choice between her two homes. Drama based on Colm Toibin's novel, starring Saoirse Ronan, Domhnall Gleeson, Jim Broadbent and Julie Walters

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In Fleet, Hampshire, Stuart and his daughter Freya call upon Flo Headlam and Lee Burkhill's help to create a relaxing family garden, incorporating separate, more private spaces. Freya is looking for somewhere to hang out with friends and relax without conflicting with her dad. The garden is small and has to accommodate some storage and a place for Stuart to work and collect his thoughts. They both want to encourage more insects and wildlife into the garden and need the designers' help to make the most of their £4,000 budget. Lee and Flo both offer up schemes for consideration, but who has really nailed the brief?

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Born to an Irish mother and a Jamaican father, radio presenter Dev Griffin grew up feeling he didn't fit in with either community so hopes discovering more about his ancestors will help strengthen his sense of identity and belonging. In Ireland, Dev uncovers the momentous events surrounding the lives of his Irish grandmother's dad, his great grandfather. Following his father's line, Dev travels to Jamaica, where an emotional meeting with a newly discovered aunt leads him to an incredible document from the local Baptist church that reveals the daily lives of his great grandparents. Narrated by Phil Davis

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Brooklyn (2015)
programme.desc: An Irish woman living with her mother in the 1950s decides to make a fresh start in America. She makes her home in New York, and falls in love. However, her past catches up with her when she receives bad news from Ireland, and faces a harsh choice between her two homes. Drama based on Colm Toibin's novel, starring Saoirse Ronan, Domhnall Gleeson, Jim Broadbent and Julie Walters

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A solo climber risks his life when things go wrong on remote snowy peak, and a dog walk in idyllic rural countryside threatens one woman's life when she's trampled by cows

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Following the death of their mother in childbirth, the residents of Wolf Wood now face losing their father, who has signs of a urinary infection. Thorn the giraffe is trained so he can receive a giant pedicure, zoologist Megan McCubbin serves up some ice lollies to the donkeys to keep them cool and Ben Fogle creates a scent trail for one of his favourite animals, the tapir

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph and Tommy Walsh track the developments of two homes and a piece of land in Suffolk, Nottinghamshire and Kent, all bought from online auctions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the show from Wrexham and discovers the story behind a famous painting. Experts Roo Irvine and Philip Serrell assist the teams in finding bargains

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of the ninth day from the All England Club, featuring the opening men's and ladies's quarter finals. There was nearly an upset on Centre Court at this stage last year, when reigning champion Novak Djokovic lost the opening two sets of his match against Italy's Jannik Sinner, but the Serbian eventually discovered his best form and bounced back to prevail 5-7, 2-6, 6-3, 6-2, 6-2. Meanwhile, Tatjana Maria defeated German compatriot Jule Niemeier 4-6, 6-2, 7-5 on the No. 1 Court

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon and Keanu prepare to introduce Albie to Peggy and Stacey goes on a date with Theo despite Martin's disapproval. Kim's return to work doesn't go as well as she had hoped and Bobby executes his plan to infiltrate Rocky's stag night

programme.title: Brave Britain with Fergal Keane
programme.desc: Award-winning reporter Fergal Keane goes in search of hope in today's Britain, turning to those in hard-pressed communities and hearing stories of everyday courage. From Glasgow shipyard workers to Leeds council estate residents to tenant farmers in Cornwall, Fergal shines light on the unheard voices of courage across the country

programme.title: Joe Swash: Teens in Care
programme.desc: Joe Swash reveals the harsh reality of what it's like growing up in the care system, spending time with teenagers who are all at crucial stages of their life. Joe's mum Kiffy has been a foster carer for over 15 years and he wants to spend time with teens across the UK who live in foster care, in residential children's homes, and some who have left at 18 and are trying to make it alone, to show what growing up as a teenager in care is really like

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: A look at how after decades of violence a breakthrough was reached in the form of the Good Friday Agreement in 1998, after years of talks at government level and with the intervention of US president Bill Clinton. The programme also examines the legacy of the Troubles, with its effects on victims and survivors being lasting and significant

programme.title: Body on the Beach: What Happened to Annie?
programme.desc: Journalist Hazel Martin investigates the death of Annie Borjesson, a Swedish woman who was found dead on Prestwick Beach. Within hours of her body being found her family were told it was suicide, but they believe the evidence points to murder

programme.title: Body on the Beach: What Happened to Annie?
programme.desc: Hazel Martin pieces together the mysterious final hours before Annie Borjesson was found dead and hears an extraordinary theory that her death was a state sponsored hit-job

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Just as Sam and Jay are set to host a friend's wedding that could get their bed-and-breakfast business off the ground, the ghost of Hetty's husband tries to ruin it

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Sasappis offers to help Sam complete the B&B website so they can start taking reservations, while Pete bonds with Jay over basketball, until Jay makes a new living friend

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A father battles to save his young son's life when he chokes on a hotdog, while a fun horse ride with friends takes a dramatic turn when a young girl crashes to the ground

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble attempts a speed test on a pair of cackling hyenas and the precious baby koala has its weight monitored to make sure it is heading in the right direction. Cameraman Hamza Yassin studies the famous lions at the park but gets more than he bargained for when handsome Harry gets amorous with one of the lionesses

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Tommy Walsh and Jacqui Joseph check out a seaside flat in Norfolk, a huge house ripe for conversion in London's Forest Gate, and a property in Cardiff

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents live coverage of the opening play on the 10th day from the All England Club, featuring doubles matches in the third Grand Slam of the year

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the 10th day from the All England Club, as the Grand Slam continues with quarter-finals in the men's and ladies' singles. Simona Halep produced a dominant display at this stage last year to defeat Amanda Anisimova 6-2, 6-4. That match was followed on Centre Court by a five-set epic between Rafael Nadal and Taylor Fritz, which saw Nadal eventually take the honours. However, the victory came at a cost, with the two-time champion unable to continue in the competition due to injury

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the magazine show with stories of interest from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil thinks Lisa is hiding something from him about Louise and Sharon worries about Keanu's attitude to money. Eve makes the wrong move when meddling in Stacey's love life and Rocky decides to throw a surprise hen party for Kathy

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Tim Gunn brings all his skill to bear restoring a wartime bicycle once owned and used by a Bletchley Park code-breaker. Soft toy restorers Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell take on a bear-on-wheels, much loved by his owner Janet, who was diagnosed with cerebral palsy as a child. Plus, Steve Fletcher recruits fellow expert and sister Suzie to work on a neglected and battered old Victorian firefighter's helmet

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk discover treasures in everyday homes. In the first episode, they head to Shropshire to help a couple with an emotional downsize following the tragic death of their teenage son 10 years earlier. They discover a collection of pieces by the famed carpenter Robert 'Mouseman' Thompson, as well as breathing life back into some neglected furniture

programme.title: The Twelfth
programme.desc: Helen Marks presents highlights of Twelfth of July celebrations across Northern Ireland, capturing all the colour and pageantry of the biggest day in the Orange Order's calendar. Coverage of parades in Clogher, Loughbrickland, Lurgan, Ballinamallard, Ballymena, Magherafelt and Rossnowlagh

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The five remaining sewers compete in the quarter-finals and are challenged to make garments inspired by history's most influential fashion Icons. For the Pattern Challenge, judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young draw on old-time Hollywood glamour with a dress reminiscent of Audrey Hepburn's little black dress in Breakfast at Tiffany's. The Transformation challenge is inspired by Esme's work with fashion label Swanky Modes, specifically their range of garments made from shower curtains, and finally, in the Made to Measure, the sewers are asked to make smoking jackets

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Emily Atack already knows she has showbusiness in her blood - her mother is singer and impressionist Kate Robbins, and Paul McCartney is her grandmother's cousin. Now she wants to learn more about her entertainment roots. Along the way she visits Liverpool to hear more about the McCartneys, and is also told tales of theatrical whistlers, Welsh footballers and Yorkshire miners. Anecdotes regarding struggles with mental health still resonate 130 years later. Narrated by Phil Davis

programme.title: Wireless Festival
programme.desc: Showcasing highlights and performances from the weekend at Wireless Festival in London's Finsbury Park with performances from some of the biggest stars in Rap, Hip-Hop and RnB including Playboi Carti, Travis Scott, 50 Cent, D-Block Europe, Lil Yachty and Ice Spice

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A tree surgeon nears tragedy after plummeting from an oak tree. Plus, a cave adventure risks calamity when flash flooding causes an influx of water into the caving network. Presented by Nick Knowles

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Rabbits are fiercely territorial and here keeper Gemma is attempting to introduce a pair of new rabbits into the group that are already at the park. She first creates a wall down the middle of the enclosure so all the rabbits can sense each other, but even this is not without risk. It's Whisper they need to watch - she is the dominant bunny they expect to be the least welcoming to the new pair. Serena, one of the largest and oldest rabbits in the group, could get overwhelmed by the situation and there is a real risk of her experiencing a heart attack. Presented by Kate Humble and Ben Fogle

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin, Martel Maxwell and Jacqui Joseph follow the online sales and renovations of a 'forever home' in Whitehaven, Cumbria, a quirky corner house in Coleshill, Warwickshire, and a three-bedroom terraced house in Goldborne, Greater Manchester

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from the Gloucester Antiques Centre, where the red and blue teams go shopping for treasures with experts Kate Bliss and Charles Hanson. Away from the contest, Charlie learns about astronomer William Herschel, who discovered the planet Uranus

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents live coverage of the 11th day from the All England Club, featuring the ladies' singles semi-finals. Ons Jabeur reached the first of her two Grand Slam finals in 2022 at this stage last year when she claimed a 6-2, 3-6, 6-1 victory over Tatjana Maria. Elena Rybakina was confirmed as her opponent in the showpiece match when she produced an impressive display to prevail 6-3, 6-3 against 2019 champion Simona Halep

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: On a trip to the Peak District, Mark Wright, his brother Josh and father Mark Sr begin take to the water on the River Derwent. Josh and Mark's kayak down the rapids becomes a no-holds-barred race, leaving one triumphant and the other fuming. Mark Sr meanwhile takes a more relaxed journey downstream, taking in the scenery from the comfort of a rubber ring. Next stop is the town of Bakewell, where they sample its famous sweet delicacies. That night they set up camp and as the sun sets, Josh reveals how he's feeling about his footballing career drawing to a close and his fears for the future

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In Fleet, Hampshire, Stuart and his daughter Freya call upon Flo Headlam and Lee Burkhill's help to create a relaxing family garden, incorporating separate, more private spaces. They both want to encourage more insects and wildlife into the garden and need the designers' help to make the most of their £4,000 budget. programme.desc: Musician Iain Spanish MacKay meets those behind his favourite Celtic Rock records, including Runrig, Simple Minds, Thin Lizzy, Big Country, Wolfstone, Tide Lines and Peat & Diesel

programme.title: Seòid a' Chidsin - The Kitchen Coves
programme.desc: The lads return to Ruaridh's first job in a bakery and make pastry to use in the kitchen

programme.title: Sgeulachd Cogaidh na h-Artaig/Untold Arctic Wars
programme.desc: The big picture of events in the Arctic during the Second World War, highlighting the importance of the battles in that arena for the course of the war in general

programme.title: Dealbh is Slighe
programme.desc: Calum Maclean tries out a new photography technique, but will it turn out to be a success for him?

programme.title: OMC!
programme.desc: Sketch show featuring a collection of comic characters, spoofs, unrequited love and comedy horror

programme.title: Alba Today

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adll Ray hosts as husband and wife Tony and Caroline from Bromley, south London, San Francisco-born Eric and his husband Russell, and childhood sweethearts Ruka and Ibrahim from Peckham, south London, use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show: Live

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars

programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Ellie Simmonds: Finding My Secret Family
programme.desc: Gold-winning Paralympian swimmer Ellie Simmonds won the nation's hearts when she took part in Strictly Come Dancing, the first person with dwarfism to compete on the show. Ten days after she was born, Ellie was placed for adoption, and has often wondered if this decision was taken after her parents were told she had a disability. Now she wants to find her birth mother, and gain a wider understanding about why children from diverse backgrounds are more likely to be placed for adoption

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 10, featuring a 167.5km route from Vulcania to Issoire. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Peter Kennaugh and Ellen van Dijk, reports by Daniel Friebe and Matthew Rendell, and commentary from Ned Boulting and David Millar

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: As a population we're living longer than ever before, but the years we're adding to our lives aren't necessarily the healthiest. In the UK, people are living on average 12 years in poor health - 14 per cent longer than in 1990. But what can we do to stop that? In the first of two programmes looking at healthy ageing, journalist Lara Lewington explores the lifestyle changes that might help us all live better for longer

programme.title: Murder in the Family
programme.desc: One week into Covid lockdown, builder Rob murdered his wife Kelly and their two children, before turning the gun on himself. They had been seemingly happily married for 15 years. Elsewhere, supposedly mild-mannered Andrew Hooper stalked and shot his ex-wife Cheryl just inches away from her 14-year-old daughter. The first of this victim-led documentary series revisits events leading to the murders

programme.title: The Motorbike Show
programme.desc: Henry Cole rides through the gloriously traffic-free Lincolnshire Wolds, meets the Lincolnshire Ladies bike club and heads north to Langen Motorbikes in Wigan. Henry and Allen Milliard also attempt to break the world record for riding pillion. They get very close, but will they make it?

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef heads to the house of the founding father of Impressionism, Claude Monet, in Giverny, where he wastes no time in walking over the famous Japanese bridge to gaze at the water lillies. With his tour of the iconic garden complete, James sets up his mobile kitchen to cook a dish of crab and dulse, inspired by Monet's need to provide large meals for the brood of eight children he had with his second wife. He also takes a peek inside Monet's kitchen, and samples a pike dish served up by local chef Eric Guerin. A trip to a nearby orchard affords James the chance to prepare apple doughnuts, before he returns hope to cook Normandy tart - a local pudding - and an inventive omelette
