programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: As a population we're living longer than ever before, but the years we're adding to our lives aren't necessarily the healthiest. In the UK, people are living on average 12 years in poor health - 14 per cent longer than in 1990. But what can we do to stop that? In the first of two programmes looking at healthy ageing, journalist Lara Lewington explores the lifestyle changes that might help us all live better for longer

programme.title: Murder in the Family
programme.desc: One week into Covid lockdown, builder Rob murdered his wife Kelly and their two children, before turning the gun on himself. They had been seemingly happily married for 15 years. Elsewhere, supposedly mild-mannered Andrew Hooper stalked and shot his ex-wife Cheryl just inches away from her 14-year-old daughter. The first of this victim-led documentary series revisits events leading to the murders

Medical drama starring Natalie Anderson, Robert Daws and Wendy Craig

programme.desc: When Matron is attacked by a thief, everyone is surprised to discover who was responsible - but there appears to be more to the case than meets the eye. Medical drama, starring Wendy Craig, Paul Fox, Robert Daws and Amy Robbins

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth has retired to a charming English village in the hope of finding peace and quiet. However, the murder of a rich industrialist neighbour forces him to leave his new lifestyle behind as he plunges into a sordid world of blackmail and envy, aided by the dogged Chief Inspector Japp. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, Philip Jackson, Malcolm Terris and Oliver Ford Davies

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A mysterious marksman sharpens up his sniper skills on a flock of unsuspecting sheep, before heading for Aidensfield and murdering Liz's ex-boyfriend, a newly arrived doctor. While she attempts to comfort the victim's bereaved spouse, Bellamy is shot in the arm and sets out in pursuit of the rifle-toting villain. Drama, with Jason Durr making his final appearance as Mike Bradley

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The Aidensfield residents are up in arms over the noisy lorries rumbling through the village on their way to Jim Pinder's quarry, and David joins the protest, only to end up spending a night in the cells. Sheep are stolen from Lily Barton's land, and her neighbour promptly becomes the prime suspect - only for her farm to be set alight. Meanwhile, Bellamy strives to fan the flames of passion with Gina. Jean Alexander guest stars

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Cleaner Luke Sumner's body is discovered close to his flat in Newcastle, but pathology concludes that the killing blow could have occurred several hours before he succumbed to his injuries, prompting Vera to piece together the victim's final hours in order to investigate his murder. But Luke lived a simple life and had even severed all ties to the quaint rural village where he grew up - including his mother Carmel. Can she shed any light on her son's murder?

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: For two years, Stephanie Blake has been tormented by a cyberstalker whose e-mails have grown more intimidating over time, but without an actual physical threat against her, there is little the team can do to help. Then, the case turns into a murder investigation, and one of the officers becomes a key witness for the prosecution, but the question arises as to how far he will go to bring the right man to justice. Guest starring Anna Chancellor (Four Weddings and a Funeral)

programme.desc: Japp and Poirot investigate the murder of an actress's estranged husband, only to find in the theatrical world, where deception and play-acting are a way of life, nothing is quite what it seems. In time-honoured fashion, it initially looks as though the butler did it - but subsequent inquiries throw up a veritable rogues' gallery of equally likely suspects. Philip Jackson, David Suchet and Hugh Fraser star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Steve Crane's wayward mother Babs arrives in Aidensfield, having fallen out with her screenwriter boyfriend and grown tired of the London arts scene. She causes all manner of chaos when a spate of burglaries provides her with the ideal opportunity to put her self-defence skills into practice. Meanwhile, Vernon Scripps has an amazing change in fortune. Rural drama, starring James Carlton

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A dangerous ex-con returns to Aidensfield hoping to exact revenge on Merton, the officer who apprehended him, and takes Jenny hostage. Meanwhile, the village is rocked by a spate of car thefts and Vernon organises a charity auction. Drama, starring Duncan Bell, Sarah Tansey and Paul Brennan

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Wealthy betting shop tycoon Alun Wilmott is shot and killed during a home invasion, leaving his wife and daughter traumatised - with large amounts of cash missing from his personal safe, it is assumed he is the unlucky victim of a burglary. Vera suspects an inside job in the shape of Alun's head of private security, Ciaran Duggan, whose history of violent crime calls his reformed character into question. Can the team find the evidence to pin the crime on their prime suspect - or are they looking in the wrong place? Brenda Blethyn stars, with guest appearances from Karl Collins, Patrick Robinson and Katy Carmichael

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin investigate when former top-flight footballer Robbie Nichols is murdered in the East End of London, in what appears to be a robbery gone wrong. They question a man seen in the area on the night of the killing, who protests his innocence and points the finger at a known gangster he claims was also at the scene. With the detectives at odds over who to believe, Steel finds it increasingly difficult to prosecute the accused. Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Ben Daniels star

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: It's the day of Saif's funeral, and as Jenn watches closely for any suspicious behaviour, divisions within the Rahman household widen. Adnan is anxious about the repercussions of last night's incident, but Jenn's attempts to help are overshadowed by Mariam's reaction to events at the funeral. Back at the station, Clarkie's investigation leads to a significant breakthrough about a possible motive for Saif's murder, which suggests the killer might be connected to the Rahmans. But before Jenn can investigate further, some shocking personal news throws her off course. Crime drama, starring Marsha Thomason

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners visit The Crossings Inn near Carlisle, Cumbria. The guests are impressed by the cleanliness but bemused by the separate bathrooms. An afternoon on the farm gets everyone up close and personal with the local livestock and Stephen shares his farm-to-plate philosophy

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&Bers head to Wales' Conwy Valley, where self-confessed 'lady of the manor' Jane and her friend Sharon host at Plas Maenan Country House. Jane lovingly restored her spectacular country pile to its former glory, and the breathtaking views prove popular. However, it seems her restoration work doesn't meet everyone's standards, as some guests bemoan the patchy paintwork. The breakfast buffet the next morning also results in mixed appraisals

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Payment day sees emotions are running high as the B&Bers pour over their assessments. programme.title: Untold: Konan - Trapped in Trauma

programme.title: The Change

programme.title: Evacuation
programme.desc: British soldiers come face to face with the enemy when Taliban fighters breach the airfield. programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi and sketch comedian Doon Mackichan visit Donegal in the Republic of Ireland to see what it has to offer. Their first stop is at Tuath na Mara which boasts access to a secluded sandy cove, perfect for outdoor swimming enthusiast Doon. Sandi shares a personal confession and the pair go for an icy dip in the North Atlantic. Next, the duo stay at the eco-resort Lough Mardal Lodge where they meet miniature cows and share stories of Mongolian princesses. They end their adventure in the countryside just north of Donegal Bay where they stay in Candlewick Cottage in which Doon serenades Sandi with improvised comedy tunes on the piano

programme.title: Murder in the Alps
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the 2012 murder of British computer engineer Saad Al-Hilli, his dentist wife Ikbal, and her mother Suhaila in the woods near Lake Annecy, a case that has gone unsolved for 10 years. Caught up in a media whirlwind, Saad's brother Zaid was eventually arrested under suspicion of conspiracy to murder and accused of organising the killings of his brother and family over an inheritance dispute, but was cleared and released. Telling the full story for the first time, Zaid is joined by former French prosecutor Eric Maillaud, retired British senior investigating officer Mark Preston, and journalist Tom Parry

programme.title: Murder in the Alps
programme.desc: The second episode sees Saad Al-Hilli's brother Zaid arrested on suspicion of conspiracy to murder, and follows leads that take investigators to Switzerland, Iraq and the USA. Detectives hunt for a motorcyclist with a distinctive helmet spotted near the crime scene, the FBI help to uncover a secret marriage, journalists dig into connections with the Iraqi regime, and police find a Swiss bank account containing almost a million euros

programme.title: Murder in the Alps
programme.desc: The conclusion of the crime documentary asks why so much attention was focused on prime suspect Zaid Al-Hilli, who was eventually released without charge. Former senior investigating police officer Mark Preston turns the case on its head with a surprising new theory, and other investigators examine whether the killer could still be found, almost a decade after the shootings

programme.title: Wonders of the World I Can't See
programme.desc: Chris McCausland and Liza Tarbuck head to Canada to experience the majestic natural marvel that is Niagara Falls. It's the only wonder in the series that makes a noise, so Chris is especially excited to be here. The pair explore the wider Canadian cultural landscape of axe throwing, bushcraft and poutine before heading into the heart of the falls for an emotional final experience

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi and comedian, actor and writer Roisin Conaty explore Wales from the Pembrokeshire Coast to the English border staying in the best retreats the country has to offer. Starting with Seren Mor near the Nevern Estuary, Roisin is blown away by the contemporary architecture and dogs on the beach. Electric bikes take the pair over to Powys where they stay at the Hergest Lee Cabin and Lean-To, styled with quirky design and mid-century furnishings. Finally, the pair top off their escape in Moor Tower, a refurbished folly by Hay on Wye just a mile from the Welsh boarder boasting views of the Black Mountains, The Brecon Beacons and the Wye Valley

programme.title: Supermarkets Unwrapped
programme.desc: The team head for the Vegan Aisle for all the news on animal-free food. Helen Lawal visits Tesco to find out how they keep up with all the plant-based burger trend, John Whaite seeks out the secret to the snap in a vegan sausage skin, Kate Quilton finds out how exactly you milk an oat, and Briony May Williams learns how to make a quiche without egg

programme.title: Evacuation
programme.desc: When a deadly explosion goes off in the sewage canal outside the evacuee handling centre, British soldiers rush to search for anyone who can be saved. Working through the night with medics, they save and treat thousands of injured Afghans and American Marines and as they pull back from the Baron Hotel, they close the gate on hundreds of vulnerable civilians. Ultimately, the 20-year war comes to a tragic and unsatisfying end as the RAF turn to airlifting their own forces out of the country

programme.title: The Scottish Island That Won the Lottery

programme.title: Celebrity Save Our Sperm

However, studies have shown it's possible to transform men's sperm count in just two to three months through a few lifestyle changes so, here, across eight weeks, Made in Chelsea star Ollie Locke, Radio 1 DJ Melvin Odoom and comedian Russell Kane take part in a series of experiments in an attempt to increase their sperm count in just 10 weeks. programme.desc: In 1971, an American military analyst uncovers the depths of the US government's deceptions about the futility of the Vietnam War, and takes action by copying top-secret documents that would become the Pentagon Papers. Washington Post owner Kay Graham and her editor Ben Bradlee discover The New York Times is preparing an explosive expose on those papers and, determined to compete, set out to publish them first. programme.desc: The host enjoys a three-day trip in York. While it's a small city, York packs in almost 2,000 years of history and has been at the centre of some of the most important events in British history. Heading to the famous Gothic York Minster, climbing the city walls and taking a tour that focuses on the life of Guy Fawkes, Gregg uncovers a history that introduces him to Romans, Vikings, and medieval and Tudor kings. He also meets one of Yorkshire's best chefs, who cooks a menu filled with one of Gregg's favourite ingredients - rhubarb

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Mayor Humdinger builds a robot shark to scare everyone away so he can have the beach to himself

programme.title: Buchanan Rides Alone (1958)
programme.desc: A drifter rides into a town dominated by the members of a ruthless family. He befriends a Mexican in jail for killing a man who attacked his sister and tries to save him from the gallows, getting caught up in the evil clan's running internal conflicts in the process. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Craig Stevens, Manuel Rojas and Barry Kelley

programme.title: All the King's Men (1949)
programme.desc: A small-town senator wins popular support by railing against the corruption of the political establishment and vowing to defend the interests of ordinary working people. However, once in office, he succumbs to greed as readily as those he once so virulently condemned. Political drama, starring Broderick Crawford, Joanne Dru, John Ireland and Mercedes McCambridge

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared (1959)
programme.desc: The leaders of the tiny European duchy of Grand Fenwick decide to solve their bankruptcy problem by declaring war on the USA. They confidently expect to lose and thereby qualify for economic aid - but the plan takes an unexpected turn for the worse when the Americans surrender. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers in three roles, with Jean Seberg, William Hartnell, David Kossoff and Leo McKern

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma (1957)
programme.desc: A farmer in need of money agrees to guard a notorious outlaw until the train arrives to transport him to jail. Meanwhile, the pair are holed up in a hotel, where his prisoner plays mind games with him - and the villain's cohorts are waiting outside ready to engineer an escape. Western adapted from a novel by Elmore Leonard, with Van Heflin, Glenn Ford, Felicia Farr and Leora Dana

programme.title: Now You See Me 2 (2016)
programme.desc: A gang of magicians-turned-criminals is reunited for a comeback performance by a ruthless technology magnate, whose actual goal is to force the team into carrying out a seemingly impossible heist on his behalf. The illusionists realise their only hope of avoiding the law is to perform one last unprecedented stunt to expose the businessman's illegal activities. Crime thriller sequel, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo, Daniel Radcliffe and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: Hitman (2007)
programme.desc: A genetically engineered assassin, who exists at the beck and call of a mysterious organisation, fails in his latest mission, and becomes a target himself, as security forces worldwide become aware of his existence and a rival agent is assigned to tie up loose ends. Action thriller, starring Timothy Olyphant, Dougray Scott and Olga Kurylenko

programme.title: Mission: Impossible III (2006)
programme.desc: Former secret agent Ethan Hunt is called out of retirement when an ex-trainee is taken hostage by a ruthless arms dealer, but when the rescue operation goes wrong, the villain decides to target Hunt's fiancee. Action thriller sequel directed by JJ Abrams, starring Tom Cruise, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Michelle Monaghan, Ving Rhames and Simon Pegg

programme.title: Last Action Hero (1993)
programme.desc: A boy watching an action movie is transported into the film by a magic ticket and meets its hero figure, who refuses to believe he is a fictional character. Matters take a turn for the worse when the screen villain gets hold of the ticket and crosses over into the real world - where bad guys can win. Comedy adventure, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Austin O'Brien, Charles Dance, F Murray Abraham and Anthony Quinn

programme.title: Tobruk (1967)
programme.desc: Jewish resistance fighters out to destroy Nazi fuel bunkers during the North African campaign recruit a Canadian major experienced in desert warfare. Risking life and limb, they pose as a German transport detail escorting British prisoners, but it becomes clear that someone in their group is a traitor. Second World War adventure, starring George Peppard, Rock Hudson, Nigel Green and Guy Stockwell

programme.title: Arizona Raiders (1965)
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the American Civil War, two Confederate soldiers are offered a way out of jail. Their former comrades-in-arms are now a gang of bandits terrorising Arizona, and the two prisoners are sent to infiltrate the group and bring them to justice. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Buster Crabbe, Ben Cooper and Gloria Talbott

programme.title: Gideon of Scotland Yard (1958)
programme.desc: Police inspector George Gideon experiences an eventful day's work. He learns one of his detectives has accepted bribes, goes on the trail of a murderous maniac and tracks a woman suspected of robbery. He also helps foil a bank heist and gets off on the wrong foot with an eager young constable. John Ford's drama, starring Jack Hawkins, Dianne Foster, Anna Lee and Anna Massey

programme.title: Carry On Regardless (1961)
programme.desc: A businessman starts up an odd-job agency, but employs seven hopeless handymen incapable of completing any task without causing utter chaos. Matters come to a head when their landlord tries to evict them - forcing the bungling workmen to finally prove their worth. Slapstick comedy, starring Sid James, Charles Hawtrey and Kenneth Williams

programme.title: Sahara (2005)
programme.desc: An explorer stumbles upon evidence that an American Civil War battleship, which was laden with treasure when it sank without trace, has ended up somewhere in the Sahara. However, he is deflected from his mercenary quest to find the hoard by an encounter with a tenacious doctor, whose battle to stop the spread of a deadly disease could be linked to his own mission. Adventure, starring Matthew McConaughey, Penelope Cruz and Steve Zahn

programme.title: Silk Road (2021)
programme.desc: DEA agent Rick Bowden is reassigned to cyber crime, and following a visit to one of his informants, Bowden begins gathering evidence on Silk Road, which is generating $1.2million a day through the anonymous sale of narcotics. Meanwhile, site owner Ross Ulbricht ignores the dire warnings of girlfriend Julia and best friend Max to obsessively expand his empire, with the help of one of his most trusted vendors. Thriller, starring Nick Robinson, Jason Clarke and Jennifer Yun

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol (2011)
programme.desc: Secret agent Ethan Hunt and his team are implicated in a bombing at the Kremlin, forcing the American president to declare them fugitives. The spies plan to clear their name by abducting the real terrorist, which leads them into a pursuit around the globe. However, Hunt cannot be sure his colleagues are trustworthy. Action adventure sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Simon Pegg and Paula Patton

programme.title: The Last Tree (2019)
programme.desc: A British boy of Nigerian heritage enjoys a happy childhood with his foster mother in rural Lincolnshire, but his life is thrown into upheaval when he is returned to his biological mother, and uprooted to the unfamiliar world of inner city London. Drama, starring Samuel Adewunmi and Gbemisola Ikumelo

programme.title: Texas Lady (1955)
programme.desc: A woman arrives in Texas to take over the local newspaper, and vows to use it to expose corruption. Her first target is the gambler she wrongly holds responsible for her father's suicide, but who proves an unlikely ally when she faces the real villains - two cattle barons who rule the town with an iron fist. Western, with Claudette Colbert, Barry Sullivan and Gregory Walcott

programme.title: Footsteps in the Fog (1955)
programme.desc: A prominent Victorian gentleman thinks he has got away with poisoning his wife, but his shrewd maid knows the sordid truth and uses it to blackmail him. As the killer's social standing improves, he realises he has to get rid of the scheming servant once and for all, but his plans to dispose of her lead him into even more danger. Period thriller, with Stewart Granger, Jean Simmons and Bill Travers

programme.title: The Green Man (1956)

programme.title: Zulu (1964)
programme.desc: An upper-class soldier and his fellow officer stationed at Rorke's Drift in 1879 discover they have been cut off after the destruction of the main British army column in the area. They must rally their small force of 140 men against the might of 4,000 Zulu warriors advancing on their position. Fact-based historical drama, starring Michael Caine, Stanley Baker, Jack Hawkins, Ulla Jacobsson, Nigel Green and Chief Buthelezi, with narration by Richard Burton

programme.title: Bride Wars (2009)
programme.desc: Two lifelong best friends discover their weddings have been scheduled on the same day and at the same venue. Comedy, starring Kate Hudson, Anne Hathaway, Candice Bergen and Chris Pratt

Spy thriller sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Rebecca Ferguson and Simon Pegg

First up is 30-year-old woman Emmy-Lou from Brighton, who has appeared on the show twice before, both times in the pod. Now she is back as the picker, unaware she is in for a big surprise. She is followed by 20-year-old Charlie from Oxford, a forensics student who hopes to find his ideal partner in crime

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including Politics Live, After Life, Dancing on Ice: The Final, Only Connect, Cheat, and Baewatch: Parental Guidance. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively discussions from the comfort of their own homes. Narrated by Craig Cash. From March 2019

programme.title: First Dates Specials
programme.desc: Blonde bombshell Dominique meets mortgage advisor Buddy, hoping he will match her conversational prowess and be willing to accept her just the way she is - loud laugh included. Self-confessed softy Issac attempts to get over being homeless for three years following his mother death by meeting up with feisty single mum Maya. Elsewhere, retired nurse Sue has a penchant for Jeremy Corbyn's look and anticipates retired electrician Peter will fit the bill, and Disney superfan James hopes his date will be a fairy-tale romance worthy of his favourite films

programme.title: Rick and Morty
programme.desc: When parasites threaten to take over the world by placing memories in people's heads and multiplying through flashbacks, the Smith house is locked down. programme.title: Robot Chicken
programme.desc: The creators ponder what a Diablo Cody eulogy would be like. The Joker finally gets what's coming to him. And find out how the Robot Chicken Nerd would fare in the world of Tron

programme.title: Robot Chicken

The chef also tries to improve the presentation of dishes emerging from the kitchen

They especially love the stunning beaches and mountains of the north coast and have asked Scarlette Douglas to find the perfect property for them to enjoy. For their budget of £220,000, Scarlette lines up five options for them and their two children to consider

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Essex, where Henry restores a car trailer and a 1970s racing bike, and Simon turns his attention to lovingly restoring a vintage model aircraft

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives look for the potential heirs of Birmingham pen-maker Gordon Clarke, who is said to have left a £40,000 estate, and also investigate the case of Jack Thornton, whose family name is revealed to have a surprising heritage

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives continue the two-year search for the beneficiaries of mariner Josiah Webbe's £70,000 estate, a hunt that has so far stretched from the Caribbean to Wales. They also try to track down the identities of a man's parents

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at BnB at 43 in Richmond, North Yorkshire, where Jenny and Johnny Hatch hope their guests will enjoy a home-from-home experience

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dazzling decor and cleanliness concerns give guests opposing views of Sutton Park in Blackpool, before a breakfast buffet comes under scrutiny in the morning

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group head to Edburton in West Sussex, and Tottington Manor, where owners Debra and Jamie Tombs claim to offer the 'Manor House' experience

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at Flynn's Pub and Guesthouse in Hackney, east London, run by friends Serena and Kelly, who pride themselves on having clean and stylish rooms

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: It is the final day and the B&B owners meet for the last time to settle some scores. Jenny and Johnny want to get to the bottom of the stain on Kelly and Serena's stay

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Black rhino Kitani is due to give birth at Chester Zoo and help swell the ranks of this endangered species, but, having lost three previous calves, it is a worrying time and the keepers are concerned that things aren't going to plan. The zoo also has four rare new arrivals called tenrecs, mysterious mammals from Madagascar and, with so little known about them, the keepers try everything they can to help them breed, while red river hog Mali has given birth to twins, but tearaway dad Confetti is a threat to his own babies

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary following the staff of Woodgreen animal charity, who are committed to matching their homeless dogs with prospective owners. An eight-stone Newfoundland makes a favourable first impression on the Coxon family, but staff are worried that his habit of showering everyone with a spray of slobber may take some of the gloss off. Nine-week-old French bulldog Kevin competes with a nervous terrier to win the hearts of loved-up couple Ryan and Katie, while a recently widowed grandmother seeks another 'beating heart' to help fill a home that is feeling very empty

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Design engineer Joe Stuart and service designer Lina Nilsson take on the London property market, as they build their own home on a small 38-square-metre plot. Joe designs a split-level house that will cleverly maximise the space, but the project soon runs months behind schedule, and thousands of pounds over their £160,000 budget

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

A five-year-old girl is brought into the paediatric department with a large splinter lodged in her bottom, and a patient has a lump on her shoulder that has developed since having a fall five weeks ago

programme.title: Belfast Midwives
programme.desc: Natalie goes into a long labour with her second child, this one conceived through IVF, but her and partner Eddie struggle as the labour covers the day and night shifts of midwives Suzanne and Janet. Azza has to be induced but while husband Adam is working away from home in Cork a turn in the health of mum and baby calls for an emergency C-section. Midwife Alex supports Stacey through a very emotional labour

programme.title: The Emergency Ward

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line

Plus, an intoxicated man overdosed on paracetamol, insists on another drink rather than going to hospital

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 76-year-old man sustains a head injury after falling down some stairs, and his daughter reflects on how his caring for her mother through her dementia has left him exhausted. programme.title: Food Unwrapped

Jimmy visits Italy to investigate the difference between risotto rice and long grain. Matt finds out why pork scratchings aren't made from British pigs

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Two B&B owners prepare to open their business in France while also planning their wedding. There is heartbreak in Spain for the motorbike tour operators

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel the length of Britain turning unwanted junk into profit for their owners. In this episode they're on the south coast, where Henry gets to work an aircraft fuel tank while Simon gets obsessed with an iconic 1960s speedboat

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Surrey and Middlesex. Henry restores a pair of racing go-karts to race against restorer Guy, and Simon repurposes an old butcher's block into a coffee table

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers look for an heir to the estate of a man with links to 19th-century South Africa, while other members of the team search for the brother of a former Birmingham resident. Plus, details of unclaimed estates where heirs are yet to be found

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate officers investigate the case of Victor Evans from Bedford who died at the age of 88, but the common surname proves a real headache for them. A Victorian school in Cheltenham, Gloucestershire, produces a massive windfall and an unusual challenge for the team

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at the Unicorn Inn in Ludlow, Shropshire, where husband and wife team Lee and Zoe Osbourne hope their glamorous fairy-tale style rooms will impress

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the East Walls Hotel in Chichester, West Sussex, owned by history-loving husband and wife Celia and Damon Haughey, who have rejected the boutique label

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The Wheatsheaf in Sandbach, Cheshire, where owner Jake Pare and general manager Chris Baldwin hope to impress their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay of the week is at the Shawries Hotel in Blackpool, where the dated decor takes two guests back to their childhood and breakfast is a build-your-own sandwich platter

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. East Walls Hotel is first up, and owners Celia and Damon need to clean up Dave's toilet brush troubles before broaching his beef with the breakfast banger

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: The keepers try to work out why male red panda Jung is losing weight, with a full medical examination scheduled after a special diet fails to solve the problem. West African mandrill JC is being challenged for his dominant position by his sons Ludo and Jareth and, while JC is taken for some health checks, Ludo gets 'over-friendly' with his dad's girlfriend. Tempers start to fray among Chester Zoo's Humboldt penguin colony during the annual moult - can youngsters Frazzle and Munch avoid being picked on by the grown-ups?

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Cheeky Jack Russell Rocco seeks a new home after his loving owner's health took a turn for the worse, setting his sights on Charnelle and Holly and their seven-year-old son Reay. However, they have their minds set on a French bulldog. Later, fur flies as Karen and Stefano meet two of Woodgreen's biggest and hairiest residents - husky brother and sister Olli and Kalli. Jess is looking for unconditional love after a recent break-up and Staffordshire bull terrier Gloria might well be the ideal buddy she needs right now

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: After 15 years of saving and planning, ecologist Fred and communications manager Saffron Baker start building work on their new family home in a village in the Peak District. However, the couple face difficulties as the start of construction proves more a feat of civil engineering than a house build, and work comes to a halt when their self-build mortgage falls through

programme.title: The Plane That Saved Britain
programme.desc: Paralympics presenter, former Royal Marines commando and pilot Arthur Williams presents this love letter to the Second World War aeroplane he believes history has unjustly forgotten. While the names Spitfire, Lancaster and Hurricane have passed into legend, the de Havilland Mosquito languishes in relative obscurity. But for Arthur, the 'Wooden Wonder' is the plane that saved Britain. Here he meets the men who flew it, tells its extraordinary story and travels to Virginia Beach in the US to see if he can take to the skies in the world's only remaining flying Mosquito

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 69-year-old man is rushed to St George's after collapsing on a tennis court, and the resus team has to work quickly to get his dangerously high heart rate under control. Other patients include a father suffering from shortness of breath and a young man who sustained a head injury playing football. Newly qualified consultant Mehrad recounts what it's like to work under pressure and the satisfaction of saving a patient's life

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Claire, 46, has been sent to A&E by her GP with chronic back pain, and doctors soon realise she may be suffering a serious underlying spinal injury. Anne Marie has been rushed to St George's following a suspected stroke, and staff have to act quickly to help prevent any long-lasting damage, while five-day-old Gracie is brought in by new parents Danny and Jordan, concerned she has an infected umbilical cord

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics

Sammy has a cardiac arrest while working at a windfarm, and Stephen breaks his thigh while off-road motorbiking in the Pennines

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole refurbishes a classic Ford Mustang and a neon garage sign, while Simon O'Brien restores a classic Chopper bicycle and turns a bass guitar into a chair

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: The keepers are concerned about a three-month-old Andean bear cub, worrying that its mother's overprotective behaviour may curb its development. The pygmy marmosets have new babies and mum Audrey has to carry her twins everywhere she goes to ensure their safety, while young elephant Nandita is desperate to make friends with babies Aayu and Indali, but her boisterous behaviour is proving too much for them - can she learn the maternal skills she needs to win them round and persuade them to go swimming with her?

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary set inside Woodgreen animal charity, following efforts to match dogs with new owners. Rocco the Jack Russell has been struggling to find a home, though his bouncy exuberance and love of a good face lick means he could be the perfect match for Zach, who is looking for a dog not fazed by his Tourette's. programme.title: Grand Designs

The couple decapitate the building and balance a new floating timber box on top to create five bedrooms, spending as little as possible on plumbing, electrics and insulation, but stress levels spiral when neighbours grumble at the ultra-modern creation

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and the team attempt to uncover a magnificent seaside villa with a royal connection and find out how West Sussex town Bognor Regis spearheaded the good old British staycation. The house they're searching for was key to Bognor's transformation in the 18th century from a sleepy fishing village to a premier holiday spot for wealthy Georgians and the aristocracy. To find this luxury Regency villa, the team has to excavate a school playing field

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

Danni Menzies rises to the challenge to find them the perfect property

programme.desc: On the Statesman train, travelling to Snowdonia in north Wales, a retired train driver is surprised with a heritage steam railway ride from the historic mining town of Blaenau Ffestiniog. programme.title: Exploring India's Treasures with Bettany Hughes
programme.desc: Part one of two. A journey through the greatest archaeological, architectural and cultural treasures of the Indian subcontinent, starting in the holy city of Varanasi. Bettany is invited to take part in a ceremony to honour her recently departed mother. Embedding herself further into the spiritual worlds of India, Bettany heads to New Delhi to experience celebrations of Sufism and uncover the story of one of India's greatest rulers, Akbar the Great

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Jonathan Broom and his wife Deborah have put everything on hold while he pursues his dream of building a miniature Hollywood Hills-style mansion. They stumble across a scrap of land in north London, but it's fraught with problems and the only way they can complete the £1million home is by sinking half of it six metres below ground. Surrounded on all sides by their neighbours' back gardens, the couple have to dismantle walls and fences and promise to put them back together again, and that's just the start of their difficulties. Kevin McCloud follows their progress

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Staff at Queen's Medical Centre in Nottingham treat Kaeden, a 16-year-old battling a serious childhood illness, who has been rushed in after developing a fever at home. His mother describes her son's struggle with acute lymphoblastic leukaemia. Other patients include an aspiring pilot who has come off his motorbike during a track race and a man who has partially amputated his thumb

programme.title: Sky Coppers
programme.desc: Following the work of the West Midlands Police Drone Unit as they pursue suspects trying to hide up trees, discarding drugs and running away from the scene of a crime. As the team show up with a drug warrant, the suspected dealer tries to throw several wads of cash from an upstairs window - totally unaware he is being watched from above

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals

Aston Tirrold in Oxfordshire boasts six reception rooms, a tennis court and a huge outdoor pool, and has been home to the same family since 1975. Broker Kenrick heads to Camden, north London, to try to secure the listing of an uber-modern glass building apartment with three bedrooms, three bathrooms and a 900-square-ft roof terrace

programme.title: Wonders of the World I Can't See

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Admin worker Jessica Carroll hosts the final party in Lincolnshire. Despite demonstrating a distinct lack of culinary knowledge over the course of the week, including asking teacher Skip Schultz if his pumpkin pie contained pumpkin, she hopes her Chinese meal and unusual pet will impress the guests

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Michelle and Charlotte from Stevenage are looking for Michelle's dream holiday home on Lanzarote. As a family of four, they have been coming to the island for more than 10 years and feel particularly at home in the seaside town of Playa Blanca. Ben Hillman lines up five properties for their £110,000 budget

programme.title: Jamie's One-Pan Wonders
programme.desc: Highlights from the series in which Jamie Oliver gathers his favourite one-pan dishes, from roast lamb and fish pie to toffee apple desserts - all made in a single pan

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: The five remaining teams throw their experience out the window when they make 24 identical re-imagined tarts. They must tap into their creative sides when asked to serve 24 peach melbas in never-before-seen ways. In the second challenge, the teams create a pièce montée featuring 160 individual choux buns with a 'Mad Science' theme

programme.title: A Quiet Place Part II (2020)
programme.desc: Following the events at home, the Abbott family now faces the terrors of the outside world. Forced to venture into the unknown, they realise the creatures that hunt by sound are not the only threats lurking beyond the sand path. Horror sequel, directed by and starring John Krasinski, with Emily Blunt, Millicent Simmonds and Cillian Murphy

programme.title: Zombieland: Double Tap (2019)
programme.desc: A decade after they joined forces, survivors Tallahassee, Columbus, Wichita and Little Rock have become experts in identifying and disposing assorted zombies. They set up their new home in the abandoned White House, but after Little Rock heads to Graceland, the team attempts to save her from a group of super zombies. Director Ruben Fleischer's comedy horror sequel, starring Woody Harrelson, Jesse Eisenberg and Emma Stone

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Staff at Queen's Medical Centre in Nottingham treat Kaeden, a 16-year-old battling a serious childhood illness, who has been rushed in after developing a fever at home. His mother describes her son's struggle with acute lymphoblastic leukaemia. Other patients include an aspiring pilot who has come off his motorbike during a track race and a man who has partially amputated his thumb

programme.title: Sky Coppers
programme.desc: Following the work of the West Midlands Police Drone Unit as they pursue suspects trying to hide up trees, discarding drugs and running away from the scene of a crime. As the team show up with a drug warrant, the suspected dealer tries to throw several wads of cash from an upstairs window - totally unaware he is being watched from above

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George visits Manchester to bring an arts and crafts-inspired Edwardian home into the modern day. In London, he meets Flo, a first-time buyer whose flat needs a rejig to make it the sociable space she has always wanted

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Sotheby's managing director Guy hopes to secure the listing of a £6.5million 14-bedroom, five-acre Grade II listed manor house mega home onto his books. Aston Tirrold in Oxfordshire boasts six reception rooms, a tennis court and a huge outdoor pool, and has been home to the same family since 1975. Broker Kenrick heads to Camden, north London, to try to secure the listing of an uber-modern glass building apartment with three bedrooms, three bathrooms and a 900-square-ft roof terrace

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Club owner and millionaire Vernal Aley hosts the first in a week of parties on the Wirral, Merseyside, inviting feminist and student Candida Darling, party girl Chrissy Griffin, chicken enthusiast Adele Richards and project manager Stuart Leake to dinner

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Feminist and student Candida Darling continues the challenge on the Wirral. The views she holds on Vernal Aley's lap-dancing business are questioned when the guests discover a set of revealing pictures, but the night ends in good spirits

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Chicken enthusiast Adele Richards intends to use an abundance of home-grown ingredients, including freshly laid eggs, when she hosts the third party on the Wirral. Unfortunately, her efforts are overshadowed by the amount of cat hair her guests find in the food - a situation Chrissy Griffin finds immensely amusing

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Chrissy Griffin hosts the fourth dinner party on the Wirral, Merseyside, hoping to win over her guests with a Caribbean menu and a group of Spanish troubadours. However, tensions soon boil over and one of the party storms out

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Project manager Stuart Leake hosts the final dinner party on the Wirral and hopes to bring harmony to the group with a 1920s-themed event. He also gives a demonstration of his piano playing, before the contestants discover who will be taking home the prize money

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: The Cherry family start renovating their bridal suite, complete with turret bathroom, where a tricky tiling job tests Aaron and his dad Paul's patience

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Lisa and Stuart Newby are looking to buy a holiday home, but are torn between locations. Australian-born Lisa, tired of the sun, craves a property on Yorkshire's dinosaur coast, however her husband and their children would prefer something near the beach in Costa Granadina, Spain. Presenters Laura Hamilton and Sara Damergi are on hand to help them decide

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Karen and Keith Wilding and their four children plan to relocate to France, so presenter Sara Damergi helps the pair search for suitable properties in Poitou-Charentes. With a maximum budget of £70,000, they view an 18th-century property, two adjoining cottages with 11 rooms between them, a historic mill, a gatekeeper's home and a restored farmhouse

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Steve and Shaun Garner help Gary and Michaela from Northamptonshire replace their holiday apartment in Almeria for a permanent home for their retirement. With a budget of €225,000, a long wish list from Michaela and a need to be no more than 45 minutes from Gary's walking football team, this could be a tricky search for Steve and Shaun. In Malaga, Andrew and Shani Hamilton search for a place for Andy and Angie from Surrey who have a budget of €350,000 and want a lot of outdoor space

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Councillor Linda Weeks-Holt hosts the first party in Stockport, Greater Manchester, and prepares a rags-to-riches-themed dinner filled with northern delicacies. Despite one guest revealing she knows Prince Charles, Linda reclaims the limelight when she dons a sparkly outfit to entertain her diners on the keyboard

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Annie Targett throws the second party in Stockport, but her insistence on hosting a black-tie event fails to distract the other diners, who begin to search her home for evidence of her allegedly aristocratic lineage

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Civil servant Sam Kitching hosts the third dinner party in Stockport, and intends to put retired policeman John Brinnand in his place while charming the female guests. His Arabian dress code leaves the diners guessing what to wear, and the evening brings out another contestant's competitive spirit

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kristen Cooley takes on the challenge as she hosts the fourth dinner party in Stockport. She plans to dazzle her guests with an American-themed party, but has to overcome the prejudice of her diners, who think this means cheeseburgers and fast-food will be on the menu

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired police officer John Brinnand hosts the final dinner party in Stockport, Greater Manchester, and hopes to impress his guests with a Thai menu. However, his entertainment is not to everyone's taste, and he discovers how he has fared as the winner of the £1,000 is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Retired couple Dabi and Devi can't wait to wave goodbye to the grey skies of Croydon and say hola to the sunshine and heat in the seaside town of Gandia in Valencia. They're looking for a second home where they can spend up to six months at a time. With a budget of £180,000, Lee Juggurnauth lines up five impressive options, but will any wow Dabi and Devi enough to make the move?

programme.title: Charlie's Angels (2000)
programme.desc: Three private investigators are recruited to rescue a computer genius from the clutches of a rival. They discover there is more at stake than they thought, as the captive genius has created a dangerous piece of software that must not fall into the wrong hands. Action adventure, based on the TV series, starring Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore, Lucy Liu and Bill Murray

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes with UK Sotheby's International Realty, giving an insight into the exclusive world of super-prime properties

programme.title: Celebrity Save Our Sperm
programme.desc: Over the last 40 years, male sperm count has dropped in the west by a shocking 59 per cent. However, studies have shown it's possible to transform men's sperm count in just two to three months through a few lifestyle changes so, here, across eight weeks, Made in Chelsea star Ollie Locke, Radio 1 DJ Melvin Odoom and comedian Russell Kane take part in a series of experiments in an attempt to increase their sperm count in just 10 weeks. As they undergo this transformative experience, they share their very personal reasons for taking part

programme.title: Wonders of the World I Can't See
programme.desc: Chris McCausland and Liza Tarbuck head to Canada to experience the majestic natural marvel that is Niagara Falls. It's the only wonder in the series that makes a noise, so Chris is especially excited to be here. The pair explore the wider Canadian cultural landscape of axe throwing, bushcraft and poutine before heading into the heart of the falls for an emotional final experience

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including Killing Eve, The Apprentice, Our House, Naked Attraction, Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway, Celebrity Hunted and Dragons' Den, with cameras capturing their instant reactions

programme.desc: The owner of a tanning salon regrets letting an employee move into a house he owns when he is faced with complaints from the neighbours about wild parties and £3,000 in unpaid rent. A couple managing a property for their daughter arrange to sell it, only to find the tenant refuses to leave, while a housing enforcement officer goes in search of a landlord who has left a tenant without light, heat or running water

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: PC Andy Swift is on the lookout for a high-value car stolen from a dealership after being taken for a test drive, while he also searches for builder's van taken from a driveway while the owner popped briefly inside to collect his tools and equipment. PC Dave Shaw is patrolling on a night shift when he follows a car suspected of being used in house burglary

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: PC Tom Strachan gives pursuit when a car is spotted by police cameras being driven with no insurance, but when records flag up the suspect has a history of violence, an armed response team is called in too. The suspect throws a knife out of the car and then waves a baseball bat out of his window, banging it on the roof and making offensive hand gestures at the police behind him

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The firearms team mobilises to tackle a suspect armed with a pistol, and hours into a nerve-shredding siege, the man emerges with a handgun and fires. Elsewhere, interceptors Rob and Dan join in the pursuit of a runaway hatchback, while the members of the knife crime team track down a suspect on a bike trying to evade capture in a park

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Rob and Spence respond to a reported knife attack, arriving to find the victim is on her way to hospital while the suspect is locked in a property and making threats against police. Negotiations take a turn when the slurring suspect topples out of an upstairs window, crashing to the patio below. Out on the roads, Lisa and Lewis assist Lenny with the arrest of a tricky trio who are suspected of stealing an elderly man's car

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers Gav Hall and Dan Mottishaw are in hot pursuit of a suspected drug dealer, but the two-wheeled tearaway runs out of road, flips his bike over and crashes into a hedge. Elsewhere, a man wanted for ABH gives interceptors Lewis Marshall and Darren Chalk the runaround, and Jen Ellse pulls over a suspected uninsured driver, who struggles to explain the fake plates in his boot

programme.desc: Kirby vents to Eden about her relationship with Theo. Tane tracks Kahu down to the houseboat he rented with the Gym's credit card and takes his cousin to task

Baby Arissa has been brought in after a long night of crying by her concerned mum Saba, and Patrick comes in to have his large itchy moles checked over by Sobia. A young man is treated for a possible infection in his leg following a car crash

programme.desc: Colin McAllister and Justin Ryan overhaul and reopen a hotel on the Atlantic coast of Canada. Their first project is to design and transform one of the guest suites. They also start work on the separate restaurant building, which is a corrugated shed that they plan to transform with floor-to-ceiling windows. But they face huge problems getting supplies, and as winter closes in, a storm floods the hotel

The first stop is Swindon, where Dr Amir sees trainee nurse Grace, who is experiencing hot flushes, while 10-year-old Oscar and his mum Jo are hoping advanced nurse practitioner Debbie Harris might be able to help with his shortness of breath and suspected asthma

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ziva David returns to NCIS, and when Gibbs and the team help her with 'the one thing' she must take care of before she can return to her family, they realise everything they thought they knew was a lie

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs must face the consequence of his actions after he assists Ziva with the one thing she said she would need to take care of before returning to her family

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A sound-system installer is murdered after supplying goods to a strip club covertly operated by the Mafia, and the finger of blame points to a small-time hoodlum whose crime boss father is serving life imprisonment. The case eventually comes to trial - but investigators are disturbed to hear an untrustworthy government attorney is handling the prosecution. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A pregnant student is found murdered, and detectives Briscoe and Curtis discover she was strangled to death before being stabbed by the killer in an effort to make the attack seem like the random act of a psychopath. A mathematics professor soon comes under suspicion as eyewitnesses allege he was close to the crime scene on the night in question

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Part one of two. A shootout between a motorist and the police leads to the discovery of a body in a car boot - and puts the detectives on the trail of a money-laundering operation run by Russian gangsters. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Part one of two. Best-selling mystery writer PK Todd and her accountant are gunned down outside a restaurant. Miraculously, Todd survives but her companion is mortally wounded, prompting Briscoe and Green to launch a murder inquiry and discover the culprit's real target. However, they soon find themselves mixed up in a deadly case of jealousy and betrayal. Guest starring Ruthie Henshall and Tom Berenger

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The seemingly straightforward murder of a stockbroker plunges Briscoe and Green into the murky world of insider-trading and blackmail, as they learn that the victim led a seedy double life. However, their investigations take on a new dimension when the suspected killer is himself bumped off by a professional hitman. Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The murder of a white teenager in Harlem seems like an open-and-shut case - until two patrol officers are implicated in the crime. As tensions between residents and investigating officers mount, the Mayor puts pressure on Schiff to make an example of the cops, hoping it will be enough to satisfy ADA McCoy. Drama, starring Steven Hill

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee and his wife Delilah's Bahamian vacation turns into a high-stakes mission when a case NCIS is tracking of a dead escape room manager has ties to the island. Elsewhere, Gibbs fears the worst when his search for Fornell leads to blood

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and Fornell's crusade to find the head of the drug ring responsible for Fornell's daughter Emily's overdose comes to a climax. Gibbs and Vance finally let the team in on a case that has dangerous implications. Mark Harmon, Sean Murray and Joe Spano star

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Following a tip about smuggled weapons, Bishop and Torres engage in a shootout in a former sheriff's residence that's now a historical site, only to find themselves locked in abandoned jail cells there. Mark Harmon and Sean Murray star

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Four men discover they are all being blackmailed over the death of a friend who drowned under puzzling circumstances more than two decades previously, so they get together to discuss their options. The next morning one of them is discovered bludgeoned to death near his home, and Nichols and Stevens investigate - uncovering a mystery that spans 22 years

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A female student claims to have been assaulted by four men, prompting the team to investigate the victim's story and bring the attackers to justice

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A high-school sex party sparks a vaccination debate when those involved contract the measles. Meanwhile, Noah suffers another health scare

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: In an effort to find the terrorist Parsa, Gibbs and the NCIS team track down one of his cohorts using evidence gleaned from the drone attack which has killed six people and wounded a further 22. Meanwhile, an emotionally shaken McGee struggles with the ramifications of the incident. Drama, starring Mark Harmon, Sean Murray, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The murder of a port authority officer reveals Parsa's possible whereabouts as the team continues the hunt for the terrorist intent on wiping out NCIS. Bishop reveals her past association with the quarry and suggests where she thinks he may be found, but the CIA has intercepted a call that places Parsa in a different location to Ellie's hunch. Mark Harmon and Emily Wickersham star

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team uncovers faulty bulletproof vests in an abandoned truck filled with stolen USMC merchandise, and attempts to locate the source of the cargo and any vests that could have been sent to military personnel overseas. Crime drama, guest starring Challen Cates, with Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: DiNozzo confronts a man impersonating a Navy officer, which results in guns being drawn, and the only eyewitness to the case is the Special Agent's father - who is in town to disclose a secret to his son. The 250th episode of the crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A one-off edition of the documentary in which journalist Nick Wallis reveals how CCTV and technological advances are helping to ensure convictions, focusing on criminals in London involved in robberies, thefts, drug crimes, street brawls and weapons offences. In Soho, police officers monitor the activity of the area's 100,000 nightly visitors from a CCTV control room in an underground bunker, while in Lambeth the air support unit is called in when an armed gang are seen rampaging through the streets

programme.desc: Part two of two. As the case continues, Assistant DA Antonella Ricci and eyewitness Billy Woodson's mother are found dead at a supposedly safe location, killed by Colombian drug-dealers working alongside the Russian gangsters. Drama series, starring Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: When a man goes on a shooting spree in Central Park, Briscoe and new partner Green pull out all the stops to trace the weapon. McCoy, meanwhile, sets his sights on finding the killer - and the person who sold him the gun. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach, Jesse E Martin and Sam Waterston

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the shooting of a civil court judge. Catching the man they think responsible, they bring him to trial - but the victim refuses to implicate him. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The team investigates the bombing of a helicopter that left all six passengers dead. The trail leads to the widow of one of the victims, and her financial dealings with an enigmatic couple. However, as the net closes, more than one motive emerges for the killings. Real-life husband and wife Michael McKean and Annette O'Toole guest star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A teacher's body is found in the boot of her car. Suspicions that she was having an affair are soon confirmed, but the case takes a sinister turn when the trail leads to her husband and fanatical father-in-law. Jerry Orbach stars

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: When a wealthy art patron is found murdered and her body mutilated, the team's inquiries lead to failed painter Larry Brunig, who objected to the obscene nature of the art supported and promoted by the victim - and a probe into his past reveals a violent history

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Officers investigate the murder of a Navy officer killed while driving home a recently released inmate. Meanwhile, Gibbs helps Palmer deal with personal trauma. Starring Mark Harmon, Brian Dietzen, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When Sloane's name is discovered in Afghanistan at the site of an abandoned bus with a dead driver, Gibbs accompanies her on a trip to find a group of girls who were kidnapped from the bus. Meanwhile, McGee, Bishop and Torres track down a hacker who e-mailed compromising information to the Taliban. Mark Harmon and Maria Bello star

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team launches an investigation into a man's suspicious death after he is found frozen in the back of a food supply truck. It turns out the local food truck industry is quite competitive and there was a lot of bad blood in the community. Mark Harmon and Sean Murray star

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A string of murders in San Francisco bearing the tell-tale signs of the infamous Zodiac Killer leaves the agents wondering if the serial killer has returned. Meanwhile, Reid contemplates exploiting his superior abilities. Matthew Gray Gubler stars

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Police from Chicago arrive and team up with the squad to track down a suspect they had to release earlier when a crime in their city resembles a decade-old New York City case. Starring Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The daughter of a man convicted for rape and incest seeks to change the testimony she gave and bring about her father's release - but the judge refuses to reopen the case

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bomb detonates at a military charity concert, killing two men. Called to investigate, Tony and McGee try to determine whether the intended target was the 1980s rocker headlining the act or if the attack was part of a larger scheme against the military. Meanwhile, Jimmy prepares for parenthood. Keith Carradine guest stars, with Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gibbs joins forces with the FBI when the body of a congressman and former agent washes ashore in New Orleans. Together they try to determine if the murder could be linked to a well-known case the victim had previously worked on during his career. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. DiNozzo, McGee and the FBI continue to track political connections to a case, and Bishop sends DiNozzo a souvenir. Meanwhile, Gibbs and Special Agent Pride chase leads in New Orleans after evidence points to a copycat killer. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Pauley Perrette and Scott Bakula

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee's girlfriend Delilah makes a breakthrough in a case involving the alleged death of a US navy lieutentant. However, when her boss orders her to back away, she turns to the NCIS team for help. Meanwhile, McGee talks to DiNozzo about whether he should move forward with his relationship. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A one-off edition of the documentary in which journalist Nick Wallis reveals how CCTV and technological advances are helping to ensure convictions. Nick visits Stafford to meet seasoned CCTV operator and ex-police officer Barbara, who helps catch a drug user after spotting him on camera. Plus, control room operative Chris is on the lookout for regular shoplifters in Woking, while mild-mannered Jo foils a gang of thieves in Huntingdonshire

programme.desc: The relatives of a wealthy woman found in a coma come under suspicion when the team investigates her subsequent death. It later transpires she was suffering from a degenerative disease, and the theory of a possible mercy killing crumbles when the family's affairs, both financial and sexual, come to light. David Dukes guest stars

Jamie and Vinny follow up on a tip and bust a drugs operation, but their informant is later revealed to be a competing dealer selling medical marijuana to pay for her son's care facility. At home, tension mounts when Frank raises concerns over Henry's questionable driving and memory problems

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: John Drake, known to the team as career criminal Johnny D, faces trial for sex trafficking, rape, assault and kidnapping. However, as ADA Barba shores up the state's case against Drake, Benson's adoption of baby Noah - Drake's biological son - becomes entangled in the legal proceedings. As an intense courtroom showdown gets under way, the SVU faces a threat that could change the face of the team for ever. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hartigay

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team must ascertain whether the murder of a Navy officer, whose body was found on a rural road, was the result of a bar fight or because he knew too much about an attack on a fellow female officer. Meanwhile, DiNozzo and McGee begin a juice detox to purge their bodies of impurities. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo and Pauley Perrette

However, the photograph is leaked, and Roe is later found dead with a needle in his arm

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Director Vance charges DiNozzo with a special assignment to go to France, locate Admiral Kendall's wayward daughter Amanda and bring her home. Arriving in Marseille, Tony immediately heads to the local NCIS office, only to find five dead agents. After eventually tracking down Amanda, the pair embark on a rollercoaster ride to the relative safety of the nearest NCIS office in Spain. Michael Weatherly stars

programme.desc: Gibbs travels to his home town after hearing news of his father's death, while the team investigates whether a fire on a US Navy ship was accidental or planned. The vessel served as prison to several members of the Brotherhood of Doubt terrorist group, whom Gibbs was responsible for catching. After the blaze, two of those members are missing. Tony argues that Gibbs would want to know, but Vance does not want him disturbed at this difficult time. Mark Harmon stars

programme.desc: James Braxton and Irita Marriott search for antiques in East Sussex and Hampshire, where a novelty beer bottle and a fish kettle catch James's eye and Irita hopes a 19th-century puzzle box will do well at auction

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore, upholsterer Simion Hawtin-Smith and print artist Zoe Murphy breathe new life into a retro swivel chair, a large oak dining table and a once-cherished sideboard

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: A property expert offers advice on buying a second home abroad

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A look back at 10 years of documentation of the super-obese to highlight key breakthrough moments within their turbulent but ultimately triumphant weight-loss journey

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: David intervenes when a bride who has turned down 30 gowns rejects a dress she claimed to love. A picky customer has a long list of things she does not want

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride's choice of dress does not impress her friends or her dog, while a customer who has had breast reduction surgery finds herself spoiled for choice

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: An X-ray provides crucial evidence in an investigation into a case of three starving dogs, and investigator AJ confronts the owner about what she is feeding her animals

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: In Ireland, the Castletownbere crew race to rescue a lone yachtsman, who has lost his mast and is drifting 45 miles out to sea. Meanwhile, a team search for a woman in Minehead who has gone missing on a cliff top walk, and for an injured horse rider on a remote beach, the Porthcawl crew are the only way to emergency medical help

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House
programme.desc: Angus uncovers a rare coin collection and some vintage hair cutting gear. An old sea chest proves to be a treasure trove at auction

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: James Braxton and Irita Marriott rummage around the antique shops of Wiltshire and Dorset. James goes on a journey back to the land before time where he meets a famous fossil hunter. Irita takes a break from shopping to visit the site of the once-great Shaftesbury Abbey

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: The fourth leg of the trip for antiques dealer Margie Cooper and auctioneer Natasha Raskin Sharp finds the duo in Lancashire. Natasha ends up on two wheels and resorts to pedal power, while Margie swaps the 1960s convertible classic car for an 80-year-old fire engine. In a break from shopping, Natasha explores an underground world hidden beneath a suburb of Liverpool and tries to find out why it exists

programme.title: 1000lb Sisters
programme.desc: After finding out Tammy's been robbed, Misty and Amanda visit to break the news in person. With her sisters by her side, Tammy faces the results of her weigh in

programme.title: 24 Hour Baby Hospital
programme.desc: Behind closed doors with parents and staff at The Rotunda in Dublin - the world's longest-running maternity hospital, where more than a million Dubliners have been born. Accompanied by her mother Kay, Nicola arrives at the labour ward, hoping for the safe arrival of baby number four, Larkin

programme.title: Ghost Adventures
programme.desc: Ghost hunters Zak Bagans, Nick Groff and Aaron Goodwin travel to travel to Salem, a town in New England that has become a mecca for real-life witches. The trio start with Judge Jonathan Corwin's house - the only structure still standing in Salem with a direct connection to the famous witch trials - hoping to confront the spirit of the man who helped send so many innocent people to their death. Then the crew ventures to the Lyceum, built on the land of the first victim of the trials

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong
