programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: The guardian of the temple has passed on and a new Golden Dragon must be Chosen from a brother and sister - Twins born in the Year of the Dragon. Only one will be chosen. Their sibling bond tested

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: The Theo the Mouse Show
programme.desc: Join mischievous mouse Theo and his best friend Wendy in their show full of comedy, magic and song

programme.title: The Theo the Mouse Show
programme.desc: Join mischievous mouse Theo and his best friend Wendy in their show full of comedy, magic and song

programme.title: Underwater World for Kids
programme.desc: An underwater adventure that takes in the many natural wonders and magical sea creatures above and below our oceans

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Bob Cratchit fights to clear his name to enable him to return home in time for his daughter's wedding, however the evidence is stacked up against him. Meanwhile, Compeyson's behaviour leaves Amelia feeling confused but intrigued. Stephen Rea, Pauline Collins, Caroline Quentin, Tom Weston-Jones, Tuppence Middleton, Anton Lesser and Omid Djalili star in this period drama, which re-imagines the works of Charles Dickens as inter-connected tales, set in a fictional version of 19th century London

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Mrs Peel poses as a nurse and infiltrates a home for retired railwaymen run by corrupt staff who are using a radar-jamming system to disrupt the country's defences. Diana Rigg stars

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon decides the centre itself is causing strange behaviour among the staff. Chris Barrie stars

programme.title: The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin
programme.desc: Reggie changes nationality several times in his search for a new identity, but gradually finds himself drawn back to his old life. Comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered.

programme.title: The Wicked Lady (1945)
programme.desc: A 17th-century noblewoman tires of her humdrum life and decides to seek a little excitement - turning to highway robbery and murder to spice up her life, as well as getting romantically involved with a caddish crook. Absolutely fabulous classic British costume drama, with Margaret Lockwood on brilliant form as the vampish villainess, and support from James Mason, Patricia Roc and Griffith Jones

programme.title: On the Fiddle (1961)
programme.desc: A Second World War black marketeer is arrested, but a judge forces him to join the army rather than sending him to prison. He soon finds a willing accomplice in an easy-going fellow recruit, and together they concoct a variety of underhanded schemes to avoid being sent to the front line. Comedy based on RF Delderfield's novel, starring Alfred Lynch and Sean Connery

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: The story of British Airways Flight 38, which was on final approach into London Heathrow Airport when it crashed just short of the runway on 17 January 2008. What had been an uneventful passenger flight from Beijing soon turned almost fatal just moments before landing when a lack of power to both engines caused the Boeing 777 to crash. The quick thinking by the crew led by Captain Peter Burkill prevented the incident from being fatal and saved all 152 people on board

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: William has his hands full at work when he is hired by a group of bikers to organise the perfect funeral for their friend, but at home he has wedding bells ringing in his ears as he plans a romantic evening with Mary. Rick and Molly undergo a dramatic transformation for a ballroom dancing competition and Terence ends up in hospital after a run-in with a rival gang of graffiti artists. Romantic drama, starring Martin Clunes, Julie Graham, Cheryl Campbell, Michael Begley and Dominick Baron

programme.title: Castle Builders
programme.desc: Examining the blood, sweat and vision behind Europe's castles, from the nobles' plans to the craftsmen's practical know-how

programme.title: Break (2020)
programme.desc: A petty criminal seeks sanctuary from his out-of-control life in a snooker hall, where a former champion notes his natural skill for the game. He offers him the chance to turn his life around by turning pro - but doing so will mean cutting himself off from his friends. Crime drama, starring Sam Gittins, David Yip and Rutger Hauer, in his final screen role

programme.title: Two Graves (2018)
programme.desc: A doctor kidnaps the man she believes murdered her son so she can torture him into confessing his guilt. However, her desire for vengeance leads to further tragedy and forces her to reckon with some troubling truths. Thriller, starring Cathy Tyson and David Hayman

programme.title: Black Jack (1979)
programme.desc: A rascally French sailor is saved from hanging in 18th-century Yorkshire and sets out on the road with an apprentice, rescuing a young girl from an asylum along the way. Ken Loach's period adventure, adapted from Leon Garfield's classic children's novel, starring Jean Franval, Stephen Hirst, Andrew Bennett and Louise Cooper

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Documentary exploring areas of the capital, beginning with Shooters Hill, Charlton, Greenwich and Blackheath

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours of Charlton, Greenwich, Plumstead. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay.

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Featuring Woolwich, Deptford and Lewisham. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Bob Cratchit fights to clear his name to enable him to return home in time for his daughter's wedding, however the evidence is stacked up against him. Meanwhile, Compeyson's behaviour leaves Amelia feeling confused but intrigued. programme.title: The Theo the Mouse Show
programme.desc: Join mischievous mouse Theo and his best friend Wendy in their show full of comedy, magic and song

programme.title: Underwater World for Kids
programme.desc: An underwater adventure that takes in the many natural wonders and magical sea creatures above and below our oceans

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: When a drunken prank goes dangerously wrong, Arthur realises the lengths to which Compeyson is willing to go to achieve his aims, while a potential rival at Satis House gives the trickster a cause for concern. Joseph Quinn and Tom Weston-Jones star in the star-studded period drama bringing together many of Charles Dickens' most popular characters

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton visits Gigha and Jura, two islands of the Inner Hebrides that are only a few miles apart but could not be more different. He begins at the Achamore Gardens on Gigha, which were created in the 1930s by the malted-drink millionaire James Horlick. He loved Gigha's mild climate so much that he bought the island and made it his home. Today Gigha is owned by the community, and many of its residents are incomers attracted by the opportunity to begin a new island life on this small and fertile place. Where Gigha is small, lush and verdant, Jura is rugged and awe-inspiring. Despite being one of Scotland's largest islands, just 200 people live there - alongside more than 5,000 deer

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores a string of islands off the west coast near Oban, visiting Kerrera, Seil and Eileach an Naoimh. The host travels on an original steam-powered puffer, finding out about the vital role such ships played in providing a link to the mainland, as well as visiting some of Scotland's oldest religious buildings

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: The gang arrive at a village where everyone has been killed by the evil Grey Gloves Devil, and an old woman insists Tripitaka is her son. Masoaki Saki and Toshiyuki Nishida star

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: Dr Russell investigates the death of a technician and makes a disturbing discovery about one of the Moonbase Alpha crew. Sci-fi adventure, starring Barbara Bain

programme.title: The Foreman Went to France (1941)
programme.desc: A factory foreman sent into occupied territory to recover vital machinery from under the Nazis' noses. Fact-based Second World War comedy drama, starring Tommy Trinder, Gordon Jackson, Robert Morley and Clifford Evans

programme.title: The King and Four Queens (1956)
programme.desc: A gambler visits a ranch owned by the mother of four infamous outlaw brothers. He hopes to discover the location of buried treasure stolen by the criminal family, but finds himself fending off the advances of the bandits' seductive wives, all of whom hope to escape their absent husbands and make off with the loot. Western, with Clark Gable, Eleanor Parker and Jo Van Fleet

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Mrs Peel poses as a nurse and infiltrates a home for retired railwaymen run by corrupt staff who are using a radar-jamming system to disrupt the country's defences. Diana Rigg stars

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Brockley, Peckham and Rotherhithe. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: The energetic chef demonstrates how to create party food with a difference. A trip to the delicatessen counter at Harvey Nichols inspires many recipes including Parisian mustard sausage rolls, chicken tikka wrap, and prawn pizzinis, topped off with raspberry and white chocolate muffins for dessert

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered.

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: Homelessness is on the rise in the UK, but nobody knows how many pregnant women face the possibility of having their baby without a home to go back to. This programme explores the issue of expectant mothers who find themselves with no place to call home, and conducts a survey of midwives in collaboration with the Royal College of Midwives to try to get a sense of the scale of the problem. Ninety-five per cent of the midwives asked strongly felt that homelessness puts the health of the women and their unborn babies at risk. The report follows three women - two of whom are heavily pregnant - experiencing evictions, overcrowding and the reality of living in temporary accommodation for years on end

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: As Prime Minister Theresa May declares that austerity is over, the programme reveals the growing number of parents now using baby banks to provide their young children with nappies, clothes, toys and cots, with the vast majority having been set up since the austerity programme began. For the first time, Dispatches has surveyed these baby banks, to get a sense of who they're serving and the services they're providing and meeting working parents who can't afford the most basic essentials and have to rely on baby banks to provide for their children

programme.title: Mad Dogs (2002)
programme.desc: A mysterious disease sweeps the country, causing dogs to mysteriously die. In London, a recovering schizophrenic starts hearing voices in his head again, telling him he has 30 hours to save the world from itself before God destroys it. Comedy, starring Iain Fraser, Indira Varma, Jonathan Pryce and Saeed Jaffrey

programme.title: The Cat and the Canary (1978)
programme.desc: Friends and relatives of a dead millionaire gather for the reading of his will. A taped message from the deceased expresses his loathing of his legatees, and the conditions attached to the will are deliberately designed to have them at each other's throats. Moreover, it seems at least one of the potential beneficiaries is prepared to commit murder to guarantee getting the money. Thriller, starring Honor Blackman, Michael Callan and Edward Fox

programme.title: Blitz Spirit
programme.desc: Documentary series offering an insight into life for Londoners during the Blitz, which left much of the capital destroyed and claimed 30,000 lives, widening the gulf between rich and poor. The programme features personal testimony from people who lived through the period, and reveals how government information films and the Press played down much of the devastation. Narrated by Christopher Timothy

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.desc: The energetic chef demonstrates how to create party food with a difference. programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: The guardian of the temple has passed on and a new Golden Dragon must be Chosen from a brother and sister - Twins born in the Year of the Dragon. Only one will be chosen. Their sibling bond tested

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: The Theo the Mouse Show
programme.desc: Join mischievous mouse Theo and his best friend Wendy in their show full of comedy, magic and song

programme.title: The Theo the Mouse Show
programme.desc: Join mischievous mouse Theo and his best friend Wendy in their show full of comedy, magic and song

programme.title: Underwater World for Kids
programme.desc: An underwater adventure that takes in the many natural wonders and magical sea creatures above and below our oceans

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Compeyson realises Matthew is in love with Amelia and manipulatively tells him that he must continue his travels in America in order to win her love, while Bucket continues his investigation by turning his sights on Mr Barbary, who was seen with Marley on Christmas Eve. Elsewhere, Bill tries to take Nancy away from her work as a prostitute, but fails to meet Fagin's lofty price demands, and Mrs Gamp tells Silas a hair-raising story to persuade him not to live alone. Period drama re-imagining the works of Charles Dickens, starring Stephen Rea, Adrian Rawlins and Joseph Quinn

programme.title: Castle Builders
programme.desc: Examining the blood, sweat and vision behind Europe's castles, from the nobles' plans to the craftsmen's practical know-how

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: William has his hands full at work when he is hired by a group of bikers to organise the perfect funeral for their friend, but at home he has wedding bells ringing in his ears as he plans a romantic evening with Mary. Rick and Molly undergo a dramatic transformation for a ballroom dancing competition and Terence ends up in hospital after a run-in with a rival gang of graffiti artists. Romantic drama, starring Martin Clunes, Julie Graham, Cheryl Campbell, Michael Begley and Dominick Baron

programme.title: On the Fiddle (1961)
programme.desc: A Second World War black marketeer is arrested, but a judge forces him to join the army rather than sending him to prison. He soon finds a willing accomplice in an easy-going fellow recruit, and together they concoct a variety of underhanded schemes to avoid being sent to the front line. Comedy based on RF Delderfield's novel, starring Alfred Lynch and Sean Connery

programme.title: The Intelligence Men (1965)
programme.desc: A coffee shop employee has a chance encounter with a spy. When he tells the story to a customer who works in the MI5 offices, the duo are recruited to investigate a secret organisation and discover a plot to assassinate a Russian ballerina. Comedy, starring Morecambe and Wise, with William Franklyn, April Olrich, Richard Vernon and Warren Mitchell

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: The energetic chef demonstrates how to create party food with a difference. A trip to the delicatessen counter at Harvey Nichols inspires many recipes including Parisian mustard sausage rolls, chicken tikka wrap, and prawn pizzinis, topped off with raspberry and white chocolate muffins for dessert

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton tours Outer Orkney, beginning at North Ronaldsay, which may be the most northerly of the Orkneys but turns out to be surprisingly easy to get to. Paul then hops across to Papa Stronsay, which is now populated by an order of monks who have chosen to make this isolated island their home, and ends on the island of Stroma in the Pentland Firth, a previously inhabited island that was abandoned in the 1950s. One of the last people to live there joins Paul to recall when it was still a thriving community

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton visits the islands of Coll and Tiree, which though just a few miles apart could not be more different. On Coll, he meets Nicolas Maclean Bristol, owner of Breachacha Castle, who can trace his ancestors on the island back to the 14th century. Tiree is one of the stormiest places in Europe, but is also one of the best places in Britain to surf and practise the relatively new sport of sand yachting, the racing of go-carts with a sail along the beach

programme.title: Kate Humble: Off the Beaten Track
programme.desc: In mid-Wales, Kate and sheepdog Teg have a taste of stone-age life mucking in with a farmer and an archaeologist who are building a medieval-type settlement. Next, they explore the potential death traps of historical legacies at an old lead mine, where the South and Mid Wales Cave Rescue Team practise their skills using Teg as the damsel in distress. Kate also learns about the plight of Welsh mountain ponies, whose numbers have dropped dramatically, and discovers whether her legs are built for mountain biking

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: Buster (1988)
programme.desc: Fact-based crime drama about the life of Buster Edwards, a member of the gang responsible for the Great Train Robbery. Going on the run after the notorious heist, he flees to Mexico with his family. However, his homesick wife struggles to adapt to her new life, leaving the outlaw with a difficult choice. Starring Phil Collins, Julie Walters, Sheila Hancock, Larry Lamb and Ralph Brown

programme.title: Break (2020)
programme.desc: A petty criminal seeks sanctuary from his out-of-control life in a snooker hall, where a former champion notes his natural skill for the game. He offers him the chance to turn his life around by turning pro - but doing so will mean cutting himself off from his friends. Crime drama, starring Sam Gittins, David Yip and Rutger Hauer, in his final screen role

programme.title: Overlord (1975)
programme.desc: A recruit is called up for service during the Second World War. He undergoes training and gets his first experience of battle, ultimately taking part in the D-Day landings. Drama, starring Brian Stirner, Davyd Harries and Nicholas Ball

programme.title: Black Hairapy
programme.desc: Short documentary exploring the relationship between Afro hair and identity within the UK Afro-Caribbean community

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong presents the general knowledge quiz as famous faces from children's television programmes take part. This edition features CBBC presenters Anthea Turner and Andy Crane, CBeebies stars Justin Fletcher and Gemma Hunt, children's TV hosts Dave Benson-Phillips and Gareth Jones, and former presenters Sally James and Geoffrey Hayes. The famous faces try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public. Co-host Richard Osman has all the answers

programme.title: Live State of Origin Rugby League
programme.desc: Queensland v New South Wales (Kick-off 11.05am). Live coverage of the third and final match in the State of Origin series, which takes place at Accor Stadium, Sydney. The home side have already won this series, having won 26-18 in the first game back in May, followed by a 32-6 hammering in June. Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow has scored three tries in the two games so far for Queensland

programme.title: Live Women's Ashes
programme.desc: England v Australia. Live coverage of the first ODI in the multi-format series which takes place at The Seat Unique Stadium, Bristol. This is the start of the final format of the series, having been preceded by a one-off Test match and three T20 internationals. The multi-format series was introduced in 2013 and since then Australia have won 22 of the 42 matches played, with England winning 14

programme.title: Live DP World Tour Golf
programme.desc: The Genesis Scottish Open. Further live coverage of day one from the Renaissance Club in North Berwick, where Xander Schauffele was victorious last year. The American finished one shot ahead of his fellow countryman Kurt Kitayama, winning with a score of seven-under-par. Previous winners of this tournament include Englishmen Aaron Rai and Justin Rose, as well as Martin Kaymer and Phil Mickelson

programme.title: Live Betfred Super League
programme.desc: St Helens v Catalans Dragons (Kick-off 8.00pm). Live coverage of the match at Totally Wicked Stadium, as both sides look for two vital points in their quests to make it into the play-offs. The previous meeting that took place back at the start of May saw the visitors come out on top with a 24-12 win at home. The score was level 12-12 at half-time before the French side took control in the second half

programme.title: Live PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: The Barbasol Championship. Live coverage of day one from Keene Trace Golf Club in Nicholasville, Kentucky, as the event takes place for the ninth time. American golfers have won this tournament five out of its nine events, with Scott Piercy winning the inuagural competition in 2015. Other American winners include Grayson Murray, Troy Merritt and Jim Herman
